title: Social Media & YouTube Video Editor (Hourly ‚Äì Long Term)
description:
Social Media & YouTube Video Editor (Hourly ‚Äì Long Term)



We are looking for a talented video editor who understands social media and knows how to create engaging, high-retention content from longer videos.



This is an hourly remote position with long-term opportunity for the right person.



About the Role



You will take existing long-form videos (podcasts, interviews, educational content, etc.) and turn them into highly engaging clips for:



‚Ä¢ YouTube

‚Ä¢ YouTube Shorts

‚Ä¢ Instagram Reels

‚Ä¢ TikTok



Your job is not just to cut videos. Your job is to create content that grabs attention in the first 3 seconds and keeps viewers watching.



Responsibilities



‚Ä¢ Cut long-form videos into short, engaging clips

‚Ä¢ Add captions, dynamic text, and graphics to increase retention

‚Ä¢ Edit full YouTube videos when needed

‚Ä¢ Repurpose content across multiple platforms

‚Ä¢ Suggest strong hooks and engaging clip 
nts

‚Ä¢ Follow current trends in pacing and format



What We‚Äôre Looking For



‚Ä¢ Proven experience editing social media videos

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of engagement and retention

‚Ä¢ Ability to create fast-paced, clean, modern edits

‚Ä¢ Experience with Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, or similar

‚Ä¢ Reliable communication and consistent turnaround



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants steady work and consistent content creation.



To Apply



Please include:



1. Links to social media clips you have personally edited

2. Your hourly rate

3. What editing software you use

4. How many hours per week you are available

5. A short message explaining why you‚Äôre a good fit for this role



We will only consider applicants who send examples of social media clips.



Looking forward to finding someone creative, fast, and engagement-focused.

Overview

title: Shopify Website Designer / Developer (One-Time Project)
description:
We‚Äôre building a *premium ceremonial cacao brand* and need a *high-converting Shopify store built in 3 days*.



Our benchmarks (style, positioning, and conversion standard ‚Äî we must outperform them):



‚Ä¢?  ?noordinary
nts.co

‚Ä¢?  ?getmaia.co

‚Ä¢?  ?

‚Ä¢?  ?

‚Ä¢?  ?stemregen.co



We will provide:



‚Ä¢?  ?A *clear website anatomy/structure* you must follow

‚Ä¢?  ?The Shopify *Impact theme* (experience with Impact is a *must*)

‚Ä¢?  ?A *graphic designer* who will deliver product photos and brand visuals

‚Ä¢?  ?Direct collaboration with us (live walkthrough of competitor sites + our desired elements)



## Role: Advanced Shopify Builder (Impact Theme) ‚Äî 3-Day Build



We are looking for an *advanced Shopify builder* who can execute a premium, emotional, trust-building storefront that feels smooth, modern, and converts hard. This is not a drag-and-drop job. You must understand *UX, CRO, brand psychology, and premium storytelling*.



### Must-haves (non-negotiable)



‚Ä¢?  ?*Proven experience building with Shopify‚Äôs Impact theme* (must show examples)

‚Ä¢?  ?*Excellent English writing skills* (strong grammar and tone are required)

‚Ä¢?  ?Ability to build a store that looks *noticeably better* than the reference sites

‚Ä¢?  ?Proactive mindset: you bring ideas and solutions, not questions for every step

‚Ä¢?  ?Fast, clear communication during a 3-day sprint



## Responsibilities



‚Ä¢?  ?Build a complete Shopify store using *Impact theme*, based on our provided anatomy

‚Ä¢?  ?Create a *premium, grounded, ritual-luxury aesthetic* suitable for ceremonial cacao

‚Ä¢?  ?Ensure a *mobile-first*, fast, clean UX across all devices

‚Ä¢?  ?Implement conversion and trust elements:



  * Strong hero + clear value proposition

  * Social proof (reviews/testimonials)

  * FAQ, guarantees, shipping/returns clarity

  * Ingredients/sourcing sections (trust + credibility)

  * Ritual/how-to-use flow (simple, elegant)

‚Ä¢?  ?Add subtle *micro-interactions* (animations/transitions) where appropriate (not gimmicky)

‚Ä¢?  ?Implement upsells/bundles and optimized cart/checkout flows (within Shopify + apps)

‚Ä¢?  ?Integrate essential apps (reviews, bundles, subscriptions if needed, etc.)

‚Ä¢?  ?Collaborate with our graphic designer to place product photos correctly and consistently

‚Ä¢?  ?Prepare the store for *EU scaling* and high-volume paid traffic



## Deliverables (within 3 days)



‚Ä¢?  ?Fully built *Homepage* (premium storytelling + conversion structure)

‚Ä¢?  ?High-converting *Product Page (PDP)* with emotional narrative + trust stack

‚Ä¢?  ?Key pages: About, Contact, FAQ, Shipping & Returns, Privacy/Terms (baseline)

‚Ä¢?  ?Optimized cart experience (upsells/bundles where relevant)

‚Ä¢?  ?Fully responsive design + strong performance

‚Ä¢?  ?Final walkthrough + handover (settings, apps, basic maintenance notes)



## Working style



You will work closely with us during the sprint. We will do a guided session to:



‚Ä¢?  ?Review competitor sites together

‚Ä¢?  ?Identify what we want to include and what we must improve

‚Ä¢?  ?Align on hierarchy, sections, conversion flow, and premium polish

  Then you execute quickly and cleanly.



## Important



We do *not* want generic applications. If your message looks templated, contains filler, or reads like a generic AI-written proposal, you will be rejected.

AI can be used as a tool, but your response must show *real expertise, specificity, and taste*.



## How to Apply



Please include:



1.? ?Your best *3 Shopify stores* (live links) + your exact role in each

2.? ?Proof of *Impact theme* experience (stores built with Impact or clear screenshots/settings confirmation)

3.? ?In 6‚Äì10 sentences: *what you would improve* versus our benchmark sites (UX/CRO/trust/storytelling)

4.? ?Your price for this project (*fixed price for 3 days* or *day rate*)

5.? ?Confirmation you can start immediately + your timezone



If your portfolio and answers match what we‚Äôre looking for, we‚Äôll move fast.

title: Medical Biller NF and WC --Ortho Office
description:
Our orthopedic clinic based in New York is looking for a highly skilled and dependable Medical Virtual Assistant to become a permanent part of our team. This is a direct-hire, full-time position ‚Äî not through an agency ‚Äî with weekend availability and occasional overtime required.



We are seeking someone with a strong background in medical administration and billing, excellent communication skills in both English and Spanish, and a proactive approach to patient care and workflow management.



Serve as a medical receptionist, managing patient calls, messages, and appointment scheduling.

Handle medical billing and claims processing, including insurance verification. Experience with No-Fault (NF) and Workers‚Äô Compensation (WC) claims is a strong plus.

Provide administrative and operational support to help ensure smooth daily clinic operations.

Proven experience in medical billing and claims processing.

Bilingual proficiency in English and Spanish for effective communication with patients.

Hands-on experience with the Athena EMR system.

Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to multitask.

Ability to work independently and maintain patient confidentiality at all times.

We‚Äôre looking for a dedicated, long-term professional who can integrate seamlessly with our team and help deliver efficient, compassionate care to our patients.

title: Video Editor + Motion Graphics (Reels and YouTube Shorts)
description:
I‚Äôm hiring a full-time Video Editor + Motion Graphics Designer for my finance channel.



This isn‚Äôt just an editing role ‚Äî I‚Äôm building a media business from the ground up, and this is an opportunity to grow with it from the beginning.



I am building a friendly, supportive, hard-working environment. I will do everything I can for you to enjoy your work. I‚Äôll push you to get better, but I‚Äôll also act as a mentor to help you grow your skills and career if you bring the right attitude.



This is 40 hours per week, salary 60,000 - 70,000/month ($1000‚Äì$1,200/month) depending on experience, speed and skill.



Your work:



Edit 3 short-form finance videos per week (60‚Äì90 seconds)

Build motion graphics from scratch ‚Äî charts, graphs, transitions, text animations

Add subtitles, overlays, and high-retention pacing

Work fast, iterate quickly, communicate clearly every day



Requirements:



3+ years professional editing experience

Expert in Premiere Pro + After Effects

Strong motion graphics portfolio (no template-only editors)

Fast, reliable, organised, zero hand-holding

Strong English communication

Stable workstation + fast internet



About me:



I have 15 years of banking experience across Wall Street and London, and I‚Äôm a Global Sales Director at a Fortune 500 company. I‚Äôm building a fast-growing finance YouTube channel and looking for a talented editor to work closely with me. Speed, quality, and reliability are key. I give clear direction, I move fast, and I‚Äôll coach you across different areas of the business as we scale. This is a chance to grow with the channel and become a core part of a real, long-term business.



Your application:



Please watch this short video of me carefully: 

In your application, please let me know your honest answers to the following:



- Explain exactly how you would recreate this video step-by-step.

- Break down how long each part would take ‚Äî storyboarding, sound design, editing, motion graphics, revisions.

- Tell me what you would improve ‚Äî especially motion graphics, pacing, and sound design.



I want to see your workflow, speed, attention to detail and thinking process to know if you can deliver at this level or beyond it, consistently.

 & Funnels / Analytics Required)

Drive ? EDITED ? READY

title: Google Ads Strategic Consultant
description:
I am looking for a high-level Google Ads expert for a part-time, advisory-heavy role. The goal is to move past basic execution and focus on advanced strategy, technical architecture, and ROI-driven optimization. I am looking for a partner to help build the account correctly and provide ongoing strategic insights.



Required Experience & Strategic Knowledge

The ideal candidate must demonstrate a deep understanding of:



-Advanced Conversion Architecture: Expertise in $GTM$ (Google Tag Manager) and $GA4$ server-side tracking. You should know how to track the entire funnel, not just "button clicks."

-Mathematical Bidding Strategies: Experience managing the transition from Manual CPC to automated strategies ($tCPA$ / $tROAS$) and knowing exactly when the data "signals" are strong enough to make that switch.

-Quality Score Engineering: A proven methodology for improving Ad Relevance and Landing Page Experience to drive down the actual $CPC$ (Cost Per Click).

-Attribution Modeling: Knowledge of how Google Ads interacts with other channels and how to interpret "Data-Driven Attribution" to see the true path to conversion.

-Competitive Intelligence: Ability to use Auction Insights and third-party tools to reverse-engineer competitor budgets and keyword gaps.

-Landing Page Optimization (LPO): Ability to provide strategic feedback on UI/UX and copy to ensure traffic actually converts once it hits the site.



Collaboration Style

-Insight-Led: You are expected to explain the "Why" behind the data, not just report the "What."

-Flexible/Consultative: This is a part-time arrangement. I am looking for someone available for 2‚Äì5 hours per week for audits, strategic pivots, and high-level management.

-Business-Centric: You understand that a "successful" campaign is measured by profit margins and $LTV$ (Lifetime Value), not just click-through rates.

title: Remote Business Development Representative (BDR) / Cold Caller / Appointment Setter / Sales Development Representative
description:
About StoryGen



StoryGen (www.storygen.agency/) is a fast-growing B2B lead generation agency helping SaaS startups and service companies build predictable sales pipelines.



Our edge? Cold calling. Our BDRs/SDRs are on the front lines, starting real conversations with decision-makers, qualifying opportunities, and booking meetings that generate revenue.



We work with fast-moving SaaS companies, fintech, IT services, marketing agencies, staffing, and consulting firms. Joining StoryGen means learning proven outbound systems, working with decision-makers, and gaining exposure to multiple industries.



What We‚Äôre Looking For

We want a motivated, results-oriented professional who:

- Enjoys connecting with people on the phone and can confidently engage decision-makers

- Thrives in a structured, metrics-driven environment

- Takes pride in precise reporting, flawless execution, and continuous improvement

- Turns real conversations into tangible opportunities

- Is eager to earn uncapped commission based on performance



What You‚Äôll Do

- Make high-volume outbound calls to B2B decision-makers

- Follow proven scripts and objection-handling methods

- Qualify leads and book confirmed sales meetings

- Log calls, outcomes, and notes accurately in the CRM

- Re-engage warm leads to improve show rates

- Collaborate with Account Managers to refine messaging and targeting

Requirements

- Previous BDR/SDR experience with a focus on cold calling

- Clear, confident communication and ability to handle objections professionally

- Highly organized and process-driven, especially with CRM usage

- Coachable, adaptable, and quick to learn new industries

- Positive, reliable, and results-driven

- Experience with HubSpot, Slack, Coda, Calendly, or Nooks is a plus



Compensation & Benefits

- Base Pay: ?55,000/month (equivalent to USD $1,000)

- Commission: Uncapped, earn more for every qualified meeting booked

- Schedule: Monday‚ÄìFriday, 8:30 AM‚Äì6:00 PM ET

- Location: 100% Remote (work from home)

title: HOA Manager
description:
The HOA Property Manager is responsible for the day?to?day operations, governance support, vendor oversight, and owner/resident experience across an assigned portfolio of homeowner associations. This role requires strong analytical ability, impeccable attention to detail, and exceptional written and verbal communication skills. The manager serves as the primary liaison among the Board of Directors, unit owners, residents, vendors, and internal teams (Maintenance and Finance), ensuring that association operations comply with governing documents, applicable laws, and company standards while meeting service-level and financial targets.



Key Outcomes (What Success Looks Like):



Accurate, timely Board packets and meeting facilitation with clear minutes and action logs

Portfolio-level adherence to budgets, assessments, and reserve funding plans in partnership with Finance HOA

Proactive maintenance planning and on-time completion of preventive and corrective work with Maintenance HOA

High owner/resident satisfaction, timely resolution of requests, and transparent communications

Clean annual audits, renewed insurance policies, and documented compliance with statutes and governing documents

Up-to-date task/project management in Asana and on-time delivery of recurring HOA cycles and filings



Key Responsibilities:

1) Board & Governance Management

Serve as the primary point of contact for Board members; prepare agendas, Board packets, and management reports for regular and special meetings.

Interpret and apply governing documents (CC&Rs, bylaws, rules) and relevant state statutes in daily operations; coordinate with counsel when required.

Facilitate annual meetings, elections, and owner notices in accordance with legal and governing document requirements.

2) Owner & Resident Relations

Maintain responsive, professional communication with trustees/Board, unit owners, and residents via
, phone, and portal.

Issue timely association-wide notices (policy changes, maintenance schedules, community events, compliance reminders).

Manage and resolve escalations, complaints, architectural review requests (ARC), violations, and hearings within established SLAs.

3) Financial Coordination & Reporting 

Support budget development, reserve study implementation, and monthly variance commentary; review financials for accuracy.

Monitor assessment billing, collections, payment plans, and delinquency follow-up in alignment with collection policies.

Review and approve invoices, code expenses to budgets, and validate vendor work completion prior to payment.

4) Maintenance, Projects & Vendor Management (with Maintenance HOA)

Translate Board priorities into annual maintenance calendars; schedule and track preventive maintenance and inspections.

Open, monitor, and close work orders; ensure scope, SLA, and quality standards are met; maintain accurate asset records.

Bid, negotiate, and manage vendor contracts (landscaping, janitorial, security, pools, roofing, elevators, etc.); perform periodic vendor reviews.

Coordinate capital improvement projects (RFPs, proposals, schedules, owner notifications, punch lists, closeout documents).

5) Information Management & Systems

Keep all HOA Asana projects/boards current with daily updates, dependencies, and follow-ups; maintain recurring tasks and automations.

Process resale and lender questionnaire packages accurately and within service timelines; maintain fee schedules.

Maintain organized digital records (governing docs, minutes, contracts, insurance, warranties, architectural files) in the association‚Äôs repository.

6) Team Leadership & Development

Train and onboard new APMs/PMs on processes, systems (Asana, accounting/portal), compliance, and customer service standards.

Promote a collaborative, service-oriented culture aligned with company values; escalate staffing/resource needs to the Unit Head.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

On-time completion rate for recurring HOA tasks and compliance filings

Work-order first-response and average time-to-close (by priority)

Delinquency rate and collections effectiveness; percent of assessments collected

Budget adherence (OPEX/CapEx) and variance accuracy; invoice cycle time

Owner/resident satisfaction score; complaint resolution time

Board satisfaction score (post-meeting surveys) and action-item closure rate

Qualifications:

3+ years of HOA/condo association management or related property management experience

Demonstrated proficiency with task/project management tools (Asana) and owner portals; strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Exceptional communication (written and verbal), meeting facilitation, and stakeholder management

Strong analytical, organizational, and time-management skills; high attention to detail

Working knowledge of governing documents, meeting procedures, collections, elections, and common HOA statutes

title: TikTok Slideshows Creator
description:
Job Overview:

We‚Äôre looking for someone to create and post TikTok slideshows (image carousels) that natively promote our app. Each slideshow typically consists of 5‚Äì8 slides. We will provide examples and templates for both images and text.



You can post as many slideshows per month as you like, but no fewer than 30. The position is fully remote, and you can work on your own schedule.



Requirements:

- An iPhone (any version). Preferably a spare device that you don‚Äôt use in your daily life

- Strong English skills, as all posts are in English and targeted at the US market

- A good sense of aesthetics and the ability to find images and sounds that match a specific vibe

- Ability to install a VPN and ensure it is always turned on while posting (we‚Äôll provide paid access)

- A PayPal or Wise account to receive payments

- Be highly motivated and results-focused



Compensation:

We offer a performance-based compensation model:

- $80 per 100,000 views

- Views are counted at the end of each month and include views from all videos, not only those posted during that month

- No cap on earnings, your income depends on your views.



Example calculation:

If all of your videos reach 1,412,500 total views by the end of the month, your compensation will be $1,130.



Additional benefits:

- A welcome bonus in the first month if you meet specific criteria

- Bonuses for achievements or new content formats, discussed individually



Nice to Have:

Previous experience as a content creator, clipper, social media manager, or someone who actively posts on social media



All other details will be provided individually.

title: Workforce Manager
description:
Join our remote team!



We are a boutique customer experience BPO based in Charleston, South Carolina, with over a decade of delivering exceptional omnichannel support to 100+ valued clients and partners in the e-commerce space.



We‚Äôre seeking a strategic and results-driven Workforce Manager to lead our WFM function and drive workforce planning excellence across multiple client programs. In this role, you‚Äôll oversee forecasting, capacity planning, real-time operations, and reporting while guiding a team of RTAs to ensure optimal staffing, strong adherence, and consistent service-level performance. If you thrive in data-driven environments, enjoy leading teams, and love turning insights into operational impact, this is your chance to shape workforce strategy in a fast-growing, remote-first organization.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Workforce Manager, you will lead the WFM function, guide the Real-Time Analyst team, and own workforce planning and reporting to ensure service delivery standards are consistently met. You will collaborate closely with Operations to align staffing, optimize resource utilization, and ensure workforce insights drive decision-making across teams.



Your Core Responsibilities



**Team Leadership & Execution Oversight

- Lead, mentor, and performance-manage a team of Real-Time Analysts (RTAs) and a Capacity Planner.

- Oversee adherence to workforce processes, including scheduling accuracy, live queue monitoring, and attendance governance.

- Serve as escalation authority for workforce-related service risks and coverage gaps.



**Capacity Planning & Forecast Governance

- Develop and maintain headcount plans, staffing models, and schedule forecasts in line with volume trends and business requirements.

- Recommend staffing adjustments to support ramp, backfill, and seasonal changes across campaigns.

- Align with Operations on seat allocation, scheduled hours, and resource utilization targets.



**Real-Time Workforce Control

- Ensure daily service levels are met across all active queues through strategic resource allocation.

- Review delivered hours versus required hours and recommend actions such as overtime, schedule alignment, or redistribution of resources.

- Monitor schedule adherence trends and escalate recurring compliance risks.



**Reporting & Performance Visibility

- Maintain and manage workforce performance dashboards to provide visibility into schedule compliance, attendance trends, and service level delivery.

- Generate daily/weekly workforce performance summaries for Operations leadership.

- Analyze WFM data trends to provide insights for improvement and actionable recommendations.



**Stakeholder Communication & Alignment

- Act as the primary liaison between WFM and Operations, ensuring alignment on workforce expectations, escalations, and staffing strategies.

- Communicate workforce performance insights to Operations, highlighting risks and recommended actions.

- Establish a consistent reporting cadence and communication flow for workforce status updates.



What You‚Äôll Bring to the Table

- 3+ years of Workforce Management experience in a BPO, e-commerce, or service-focused environment.

- Experience leading a workforce or scheduling team with clear performance outcomes.

- Proficiency in workforce monitoring tools and scheduling platforms (Hubstaff or similar).

- Strong understanding of forecasting principles, staffing alignment, and SLA-driven resource planning.

- Excellent judgment in high-pressure decision-making and resource management.



Your Core Competencies

- People Development: Coaches and builds high-performing workforce teams

- Efficiency: Ensures resource optimization and minimal staffing waste

- Analytical Thinking: Uses workforce data to make informed operational decisions

- Work Ethic: Takes ownership and delivers with consistency and accuracy

- Attention to Detail: Ensures schedules, reports, and rosters are accurate and up to date

- Proactivity: Anticipates workforce needs and takes action before issues escalate

- Adaptability: Adjusts plans quickly in response to shifting operational demands

- Calm Under Pressure: Maintains clarity and decision-making discipline during peak volume or SLA risk

- Leadership Presence: Upholds WFM standards and drives accountability across teams



What‚Äôs In It For You?

- 100% Remote Work ‚Äì Work from anywhere in the Philippines

- Leadership Growth ‚Äì Opportunity to scale your impact and grow within Workforce Operations

- Competitive Pay ‚Äì $11 - 12/hr + benefits as an independent contractor

- Supportive Culture ‚Äì Collaborate with an experienced and empowering leadership team

- Meaningful Work ‚Äì Help drive performance outcomes and ensure team success

- Long-Term Stability ‚Äì Join a growing company that values your career path



Ready to Lead with Precision?

If you're passionate about real-time operations, data-driven leadership, and building high-performing teams, we‚Äôd love to meet you!

We‚Äôre a fast-growing Singapore-based Amazon FBA brand, and we‚Äôre looking for a strong Amazon Project Manager to help us scale.



This is not a coordinator role.

You‚Äôll be managing people, systems, and execution across our Amazon operations.

What you‚Äôll be doing

You‚Äôll coordinate shipping plans with suppliers, freight forwarders, and inspection agents.

You‚Äôll review and improve product listings, making sure keywords, images, and backend data are correct.

You‚Äôll track inventory, sales, and campaigns, and keep our spreadsheets and dashboards accurate.

You‚Äôll work closely with our design, listing, and ops teams to keep launches and updates on track.



You‚Äôll take part in internal training, including AI-powered workflows.

AI is a tool, not a crutch. We expect you to use it to think better, work faster, and improve outcomes, not to blindly paste output.



You‚Äôll help plan projects, improve processes, and make sure details like product size tiers and listing data are correct before they cost us money.

What we‚Äôre looking for

Strong attention to detail and the ability to communicate clearly with different teams.

Able to work independently, prioritise well, and adapt when things change.

Proactive, open-minded, and able to work well in a fast-moving team.

How to apply

title: Content Producer
description:
# Trading Academy Content Producer & Instructional Designer (Full-Time)



**Company:** US-based FinTech startup (trading education + SaaS platform)

**Position:** Full-Time, Remote (40 hrs/week)

**Salary:** $1,200 ‚Äì $1,800/month USD (based on experience) + 13th month + performance bonuses

**Schedule:** Monday‚ÄìFriday, with 3‚Äì4 hours daily overlap during US Eastern business hours (9 PM ‚Äì 12 AM Manila Time)

**Start Date:** Immediate



---



## ABOUT US



We are a US-based financial technology company building the first-ever Master Trader Academy ‚Äî a platform where traders learn the exact methodologies of the world's top 10 most successful traders, then practice those strategies in a live-market simulation environment before risking real money.



Think of it as the "MasterClass for Trading" ‚Äî except instead of just watching videos, users actually practice each trader's system with live market data and get data-driven feedback on their performance.



The founder has 20+ years of finance experience, has been featured in the Wall Street Journal, and is building this as a venture-scale product targeting $100M+ in revenue within 3 years.



We are looking for a talented, driven Content Producer & Instructional Designer to own the entire content production pipeline ‚Äî from building the Mark Douglas psychological foundation curriculum through creating individual training modules for 10 legendary traders.



---



## THE PROJECT (What You'll Be Building)



You will be responsible for building the complete training content for a platform that takes a client from absolute beginner to consistently profitable trader. The system has two layers:



### LAYER 1: The Mark Douglas Foundation (Mandatory for All Users)



Mark Douglas is the godfather of trading psychology. His book "Trading in the Zone" is the definitive text on why traders fail psychologically. You will build:



- 12 video-based training modules covering Douglas's Five Fundamental Truths and Seven Principles of Consistent Winners

- 7 interactive exercises (e.g., the "coin flip experiment" that proves random distributions produce winning streaks, a "Trading Belief Audit" worksheet, a risk acceptance drill)

- Knowledge assessment quizzes for each module (10-15 questions each)

- A "Trading Psychology Self-Assessment" survey based on Douglas's Attitude Survey from the book

- Scripts, storyboards, slide decks, and supporting materials for all video content

- Downloadable worksheets, checklists, and journaling templates



The goal: No user touches a trading strategy until they have rewired their psychological approach to risk, loss, and probability. This is the protective layer that prevents traders from blowing up their accounts.



### LAYER 2: 10 Individual Master Trader Modules



Each module teaches the specific methodology of one legendary trader. You will build the complete curriculum for each, following a standardized template:



**Module 1: Eric D.J. ‚Äî SPY Day Trading Structure System**

- 7-stage progression from paper trading to portfolio income

- Core concept: "STRUCTURE" ‚Äî identifying price action imbalances for high-probability trades

- Content: 35 video lessons (5 per stage), 50 interactive chart annotation exercises, stage progression guides, end-of-day trade review templates



**Module 2: Mark Minervini ‚Äî SEPA & Volatility Contraction Pattern (VCP)**

- Trend Template stock screening criteria

- VCP pattern identification and Specific Entry Point Analysis

- Content: 20 video lessons, chart pattern recognition exercises, stock screening checklists



**Module 3: William O'Neil ‚Äî CAN SLIM System**

- Fundamental + technical analysis blend

- Cup-with-handle and other base patterns, institutional accumulation

- Content: 20 video lessons, CAN SLIM screening worksheets, earnings analysis templates



**Module 4: Nicolas Darvas ‚Äî Darvas Box Theory**

- Price box identification, breakout entries, strict stop-loss discipline

- Content: 15 video lessons, box drawing exercises, position management guides



**Module 5: David Ryan ‚Äî Relative Strength & Sector Leadership**

- O'Neil protege methodology, sector rotation, 3x US Investing Championship winner approach

- Content: 15 video lessons, relative strength ranking exercises, sector analysis templates



**Module 6: Dan Zanger ‚Äî Chart Pattern Acceleration & Volume**

- Bull flags, cup-and-handle, volume surge identification

- Content: 15 video lessons, volume analysis exercises, pattern recognition drills



**Module 7: Jesse Livermore ‚Äî Pivot Points & Market Timing (Legacy Module)**

- Based on "Reminiscences of a Stock Operator"

- Pivot point theory, pyramiding into winners, reading the tape

- Content: 15 video lessons, historical case studies, market timing frameworks



**Module 8: Linda Raschke ‚Äî Short-Term Swing Trading**

- Mean reversion + 
ntum setups, "Holy Grail" setup, ADX-based entries

- Content: 15 video lessons, setup identification exercises, swing trading checklists



**Module 9: Stan Weinstein ‚Äî Stage Analysis**

- 4-stage market cycle (basing, advancing, topping, declining)

- Buy Stage 2 breakouts only methodology

- Content: 15 video lessons, stage identification exercises, long-term trend analysis guides



**Module 10: Mark Ritchie II ‚Äî Asymmetric Risk/Reward**

- 
ntum with risk management mastery, Triple-Digit Challenge winner approach

- Content: 15 video lessons, risk/reward calculation exercises, position sizing templates



---



## YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



### Content Creation (60% of time)

- Research and deeply understand each trader's methodology from their published books, interviews, and public materials

- Write detailed video scripts and storyboards for all lessons (we will provide AI tools to accelerate research and drafting)

- Create slide presentations / visual assets for each video lesson using Canva, PowerPoint, or Google Slides

- Design interactive exercises, worksheets, quizzes, and downloadable templates

- Build the complete client journey flow ‚Äî the exact sequence a user follows from Day 1 signup through each phase of their development

- Create onboarding
 sequences and in-app messaging copy for each stage of the journey



### Video Production (25% of time)

- Record and edit screen-capture videos with voiceover (showing trading charts, annotated setups, slide presentations)

- Edit video content to professional quality (clean audio, smooth transitions, lower thirds, chapter markers)

- Create short-form video clips (60-90 seconds) from longer lessons for marketing and social media use

- Tools: OBS Studio or Camtasia for screen recording, DaVinci Resolve or Premiere Pro for editing, Canva for thumbnails



### Project Management (15% of time)

- Maintain a content production tracker (we use spreadsheets and project boards)

- Coordinate with the founder for content review and approval

- Track completion milestones against the production schedule

- Flag blockers early and propose solutions



---



## WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU



### Must-Have Skills

- **Strong English writing and communication** ‚Äî you will be writing scripts that teach complex financial concepts to an American audience. Your English must be excellent, both written and spoken.

- **Video production experience** ‚Äî screen recording, voiceover narration, video editing. You don't need to be on camera, but you need to produce polished, professional educational videos.

- **Instructional design ability** ‚Äî you understand how adults learn. You can take a 300-page trading book and turn it into a structured curriculum with clear learning objectives, progressive difficulty, and measurable outcomes.

- **Research skills** ‚Äî you'll need to deeply understand 10 different trading methodologies. You must be comfortable reading financial books, watching trading videos, and synthesizing complex material into clear, actionable lessons.

- **Design skills (Canva/PowerPoint)** ‚Äî create professional-looking slides, infographics, worksheets, and visual materials.

- **Self-motivated and organized** ‚Äî this is a massive project. You need to manage your own time, hit deadlines, and maintain quality across hundreds of pieces of content.



### Nice-to-Have Skills

- Knowledge of stock trading, technical analysis, or financial markets

- Experience with LMS (Learning Management System) platforms like Teachable, Thinkific, Kajabi, or similar

- Experience creating courses or educational content for trading/finance audiences

- Familiarity with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) for research and content drafting acceleration

- Motion graphics or animation skills for more engaging video content



### Deal-Breakers (Do NOT apply if)

- You cannot produce video content (screen recording + editing + voiceover)

- Your English writing is not at a native or near-native level

- You have no experience creating educational or training content

- You cannot commit to full-time (40 hours/week)



---



## COMPENSATION & GROWTH



### Base Salary

- $1,200 ‚Äì $1,800/month USD depending on experience and skill level

- Paid monthly via direct bank transfer, Wise, or PayPal

- 13th month pay (December bonus equal to one month's salary)



### Performance Bonuses

- $300 bonus for completing the full Douglas Foundation (12 modules + exercises) on schedule

- $200 bonus for each Master Trader Module completed on schedule and approved

- Up to $2,300/month in total with base + bonuses during active production



### Growth Path

- This role grows with the company. As we scale, you'll manage a small content team (writers, editors, designers)

- Potential promotion to Head of Content / Director of Education within 12 months

- The company is targeting venture funding ‚Äî early tea
mbers will be considered for equity/profit-sharing arrangements



---



## PRODUCTION TIMELINE



| Phase | Content | Deadline | Bonus |

|-------|---------|----------|-------|

| Phase 1 | Mark Douglas Foundation (12 modules + 7 exercises + quizzes) | 4 weeks from start | $300 |

| Phase 2 | Eric D.J. Module (Stages 0-4, 35 lessons) | 6 weeks from start | $200 |

| Phase 3 | Darvas Box Module (15 lessons) | 8 weeks from start | $200 |

| Phase 4 | Minervini Module (20 lessons) | 10 weeks from start | $200 |

| Phase 5 | O'Neil Module (20 lessons) | 12 weeks from start | $200 |

| Phase 6‚Äì10 | Remaining 5 modules | Weeks 13-24 | $200 each |



Total production: ~200 video lessons + 160 interactive exercises + 28 quizzes + all supporting materials over 24 weeks.



---



## TOOLS WE PROVIDE



- AI assistant access (Claude / ChatGPT) for research acceleration and script drafting

- TradingView account for chart screenshots and screen recordings

- Canva Pro account for design work

- Access to all relevant trading books (digital copies)

- Project management tools (Notion or similar)

- Zoom for daily/weekly check-ins with the founder



---



## HOW TO APPLY



**To be considered, your application MUST include:**



1. **A brief introduction** (3-5 sentences) about your background and why this role excites you



2. **Portfolio links** showing at least 2 examples of educational video content you have produced (screen recording + editing + voiceover). YouTube links, Vimeo, Google Drive ‚Äî any format is fine. If you have created online courses, share links to those as well.



3. **A writing sample** ‚Äî take this paragraph and rewrite it as if you were teaching it to a beginner trader in a video script:



   *"The VCP (Volatility Contraction Pattern) occurs when a stock's price range tightens progressively over multiple contractions, showing decreasing volume. Each contraction is smaller than the previous one, indicating that selling pressure is drying up. The breakout above the pattern's pivot point on increased volume signals a potential significant price advance."*



   This is how we'll assess your ability to take complex trading concepts and make them clear and engaging.



4. **Your salary expectation** within the $1,200-$1,800 range



5. **Your availability** ‚Äî can you start within the next 1-2 weeks?



---



## HIRING PROCESS



1. **Application Review** ‚Äî we review your portfolio and writing sample (2-3 days)

2. **Video Interview** ‚Äî 30-minute Zoom call with the founder (within 1 week)

3. **Paid Trial Task** ‚Äî produce 1 complete mini-module (1 video lesson + quiz + worksheet) on a topic we assign. Paid $100 for the trial regardless of outcome. (1 week to complete)

4. **Offer** ‚Äî if the trial is strong, we extend an offer immediately



We are hiring for this role NOW and want someone started within 2 weeks.



---



**This is not a generic content mill job.** You will be building the educational backbone of a venture-scale FinTech product. The content you create will be used by thousands of traders. If you're passionate about education, skilled in video production, and excited by the trading/finance space, we want to hear from you.

title: Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
I'm the founder of a digital growth marketing company that helps mission-driven founders scale their businesses with more ease & less overwhelm - and I'm looking for a small team of highly-skilled Executive Assistants to help take over the marketing and management tasks that make a huge difference in the lives of the people that hire us.



I'm looking for a max of 5 amazing executive assistants available for part-time (potential for full time) with a salary starting at $500 USD per month and with long term success and robust training, moving up to $700 USD per month as an emerging leader in the company.



If you have the following skill sets, I encourage you to apply:



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

- Minimum of 3‚Äì5 years of experience in Digital Marketing, Video Editing, Social Media Management, Content Creation, and Executive Assistant Work (Administrative Tasks, Calendar &
 Management, etc)

You‚Äôre trusted to manage marketing deliverables while providing high-level executive support, keeping priorities organized, systems moving, and leadership focused on growth instead of day-to-day execution. You've done it all from managing schedules to
 & calendar management. You have a meticulous eye for detail where Prioritization and Organization are your love language



-- 1+ years of experience in Sales Funnels and Shopify

You're a professional who is passionate about helping changemakers simplify their lives by setting up systems that will allow them to operate their businesses with more ease and less overwhelm. You have experience with sales funnel and CRM software



- 1+ years of experience advertising on platforms like Instagram,
, Tik Tok, within a Marketing team consisting of Paid Acquisition, Organic Marketing, Customer Retention, & Product Marketing

You're an emerging leader who has the potential to head a team in the future that will report directly to you. Having leadership experience is a MAJOR plus



- Creating SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)

You‚Äôll ensure each business function has detailed documentation for repeatable and scalable growth if it isn't already place. If you see gaps, you take the initiative to fill them and produce results without anyone knowing there was an issue (yea, all that and a bag of chips :-)



- Experience working at a digital/online product/platform: You‚Äôre familiar with online courses, digital products & platforms and popular tools in the business space ranging from landing page builders and
 service providers to CRMs, and course hosting platforms aren‚Äôt foreign to you (We teach tools like Shopify, Convertkit, Kajabi, Teachable, Learnworlds, Calendly, etc)



ABOUT YOU:

- ‚ÄúYou down with SOP? Yeah you know me!‚Äù‚ÄîYou‚Äôre an advocate for SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to make our systems repeatable & scalable.

- Your love language is processes & predictable, meteoric growth. We never question company progress towards the quarterly and yearly goals because you keep real-time metrics for all projects.

- You‚Äôre aware of new software and can look at current systems and identify how to automate tasks a company has been doing manually for months.

- You‚Äôre addicted to digital processes & automation in the world of social media because you love building connections in the digital space and you‚Äôve seen how powerful it can be in business growth

- You‚Äôre driven by metrics & tracking. You know that you can‚Äôt improve something unless you measure it, so you develop ways to measure performance so your company is always predictably improving.

- Timeliness and deadlines are your jam. When we have a team call at 10:00am, you show up at 9:55am. When the deadline is Tuesday at 5:30pm, you have it done Monday.

title: PODCAST EDITOR
description:
Superline Network is hiring a full-time Podcast Editor to manage the post-production workflow for our interview and business content series. This role is responsible not only for editing, but for owning the entire episode delivery process from raw footage to publish-ready content across YouTube and social platforms.



Responsibilities include:

‚Ä¢ Editing long-form podcast and interview episodes (multi-camera)

‚Ä¢ Syncing audio/video and building a clean narrative cut

‚Ä¢ Removing filler, pauses, and off-topic sections to improve pacing and retention

‚Ä¢ Color correction, audio leveling, and basic sound cleanup

‚Ä¢ Adding graphics, lower thirds, subtitles, and branded elements

‚Ä¢ Creating YouTube-ready exports, thumbnails guidance, and timestamps

‚Ä¢ Cutting multiple short-form clips (Reels/Shorts/TikTok) from each episode

‚Ä¢ Organizing footage, backing up files, and maintaining project archives

‚Ä¢ Working with the content team to meet weekly publishing deadlines



Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro (required)

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of YouTube pacing and viewer retention

‚Ä¢ Experience editing interview or podcast content

‚Ä¢ Ability to meet deadlines consistently and communicate proactively

‚Ä¢ Reliable internet and ability to transfer large media files

‚Ä¢ Bonus: After Effects or motion graphics experience



We are looking for someone detail-oriented who can take raw footage and independently deliver a polished, platform-ready episode with minimal oversight.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We are seeking a sharp, proactive, and highly adaptable Executive Assistant to provide dedicated support to our CEO. This is a high-impact, long-term role focused on executive support, operational coordination, and strategic assistance across multiple areas of the business.



You will act as the CEO‚Äôs right hand‚Äîensuring priorities are executed, communication flows smoothly, and no opportunity, task, or detail is overlooked. This role requires someone flexible, resourceful, and capable of handling a wide variety of responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in ambiguity, thinks critically, takes initiative without constant direction, and can confidently manage both administrative and strategic support functions.



Responsibilities:



Provide high-level administrative and executive support to the CEO

Manage calendar, scheduling, and meeting coordination

Handle executive communications across
, phone, and digital platforms

Prepare reports, summaries, and internal documentation

Assist with research, analysis, and special projects

Coordinate with internal teams and external partners

Organize workflows and improve operational efficiency

Track priorities, follow-ups, and deadlines to ensure execution

Support documentation of processes and internal systems

Take initiative in identifying areas where the CEO needs support



Requirements:



2+ years of Executive Assistant experience supporting senior leadership

Strong organizational and time management skills

Excellent written and verbal English communication

Highly detail-oriented with strong critical thinking skills

Able to adapt quickly and manage shifting priorities

Confident, professional, and solution-oriented

Tech-savvy and comfortable learning new systems quickly

Willing to work EST hours reliably

Looking for long-term stability and growth



Schedule & Location:

Type: Full-Time, Dedicated

Hours: Monday through Friday , 8:00 AM ‚Äì 5:00 PM EST 

Location: Remote



Benefits & Compensation:



Paid Time Off (PTO)

Holiday Pay

Employee Referral Program with bonuses

Fully Remote Work Setup

Structured and professional team environment



How to Apply

1. Kindly complete this form:


/english



Please note:

A 1‚Äì2 minute video introduction is required in that form.

Once you have completed the form, please put this message for #1. as "application form done"



Please answer the following questions directly in your reply to this
:



2. How many years of experience do you have as an Executive Assistant?

3. Which CRM platforms have you used? 

4. Do you have experience using GoHighLevel (GHL)? If yes, how many months/years?

5. Are you comfortable using a time-tracking tool?



Kindly use ‚ÄúGeneral Executive Assistant - Your Name‚Äù as your subject line when replying.





Thank you!

title: Ad Creative  Editor | Full Time
description:
At Sole Assistant, we place VAs into stable, long-term roles with US-based ecommerce businesses. We have hired and placed more than 300 VAs in the last 3 years and currently support over 75 active roles. Our mission is to give talented Filipino VAs a real career pathway, not a short-term gig.

If you are coachable, fast, and eager to grow, this is the right opportunity for you.

‚Ä¢ Stable full-time work with long-term clients

‚Ä¢ Growth opportunities as you improve your skills

‚Ä¢ 3-month employment guarantee (Average employment is 12+ months)

We have a large network of businesses actively hiring, which allows us to place strong candidates quickly.



Role: Ad Creative Editor

Rate: $5/hour | Around PHP46,000+ per month



About the Role:

The purpose of the Editor Role at our brand is to process ad briefs from our creative team and bring them to life through the power of editing.



As an Editor, you are responsible for the actual execution & applying the finishing touches on all the ads we create. Our success as a marketing team will rely on your ability to comprehend each ad concept, strategically put the pieces together, and enhance the overall marketing message with your edits.



You understand that the smallest details can make the biggest differences. So, you take pride in paying immense attention to detail in everything you do as those details can be the difference between an ad that is shown to millions & an ad that is shown to very few.



Your active purpose at our brand is to work alongside our Creative Directors and Copywriters to edit & bring to life ad briefs, utilize our creative resources, and help produce winning ads month over month for our clients.



If you are a perfect fit, you will be given documents as well as reference winning ads and what makes those ads a winner and those must be studied for not only our business success but yours as well at our company. Must be ready to create 6-7 batches a week, as well as an onboarding quiz on what makes a winning ad and our target customer.



Direct Experience Qualifications:

- 1 Year of experience in video editing or designing ads

- 1 Year of experience in CapCut, Photoshop

- 1 Year of experience editing eCommerce ads

- Experience with HeyGen

- Experience with Higgsfield

- Experience with eleven labs

- Nano bannana

- Sora 2

- Working in a team environment & understanding individual roles



Character Traits:

- Excruciatingly high level of attention to detail with all designs & edits

- Artistic & creative oriented mindset

- Visual communicator & storyteller

- High curiosity & an active imagination

- Strong willingness to do the ‚Äòboring‚Äô work required

- Great communicator with the team

- Time-efficient, but willing to spend extra time to do things right

- Coachable & desire to grow skill set & personal traits



Message from the founder: The main goal of this role is to take you in house on our team and carry you up to the top as we grow. If you put the hours into the work even over time when you want to we offer compensation on winning creatives. Basically if you‚Äôre a beast and the edit gets a ton of sales we‚Äôll give you a percentage of the sales generated, lots of money to be made on this, but you have to be a super hard worker. We are working hard for the multi-7 figure mark next year. We take care of our team to the fullest extent if you give that same compassion back into the role. We want someone as hungry as we are to grow and scale far.



How to Apply:

1. Fill out this Screening form:

2. Message us on OnlineJobs with this exact subject line: [Your Full Name] ‚Äì [Your Favorite Shoe Brand]

-What do you think this job actually looks like day-to-day

title: Wordpress Specialist
description:
Hiring ASAP

Job Title: WordPress & WooCommerce Specialist (Full-Time / Long-Term)

Overview

We are looking for a dedicated WordPress & WooCommerce Developer to lead the build, maintenance, and expansion of our e-commerce sites. We are moving away from other platforms to focus 100% on WooCommerce.



You will be responsible for building new stores from the ground up, managing 
, and ensuring our entire portfolio stays fast, secure, and optimized for conversions. This is a full-time role for someone who wants to grow with a fast-moving team.



Key Responsibilities

New Builds: Develop and launch high-converting WooCommerce stores from scratch (custom themes or high-performance builders).



Ongoing Maintenance: Responsible for the health of 
 and future sites, including security patches, plugin management, and daily backups.



Performance Scaling: Ensure sites are optimized for high traffic, specifically focusing on mobile speed and checkout stability.



Custom Tweaks: Execute daily requests for layout changes, custom product pages, and technical troubleshooting.

The Ideal Candidate

You are a WooCommerce specialist, not a Shopify dev who "also does" WordPress.



You are proactive‚Äîyou fix bugs before we even notice them.



You are available for full-time collaboration and quick adjustments.



How to Apply

Please provide:



A link to 2-3 WooCommerce stores you have built or currently maintain.



Your experience with scaling WordPress sites for high-volume sales.



Your expected monthly rate for full-time availability.

title: Experienced Real Estate Cold Caller ‚Äì Property Owners
description:
Experienced Real Estate Cold Caller ‚Äì Multifamily Property Owners (Chicago Market)

Overview



I am a Chicago-based Commercial Real Estate Advisor specializing in multifamily properties (5‚Äì50 units) and redevelopment sites.



I am looking for a highly experienced cold caller who understands how to speak with property owners professionally, confidently, and strategically.



This is not a generic VA role.

You must understand real estate, ownership structures, and how to navigate gatekeepers and skeptical owners.



Your job is simple but serious:

Start conversations that lead to appointments and opportunities.



Who This Is For



You have:



2+ years experience cold calling real estate owners



Experience calling LLCs, trusts, and business entities



Strong English (clear, confident, no heavy script reading tone)



Experience using dialers (Mojo, CallTools, BatchDialer, etc.)



CRM discipline (updating notes, tagging properly)



Thick skin and consistency



Ability to follow a call framework ‚Äî not improvise randomly



Bonus if you have:



Commercial real estate experience



Multifamily experience



Understanding of cap rates, refinancing pressure, or loan maturities



Experience booking valuation meetings



Responsibilities



You will:



Call property owners from my CRM (Chicago multifamily)



Identify decision makers



Confirm ownership structure



Qualify:



Holding period



Future plans (sell, refi, hold)



Loan maturity timing



Pain points (insurance, taxes, capex)



Book valuation meetings



Log accurate notes inside CRM



Flag high-probability opportunities



Performance Expectations



80‚Äì120 dials per day minimum



10‚Äì15 quality conversations per day



2‚Äì5 warm opportunities per week



Detailed CRM notes after every meaningful call



Daily performance report



No activity without results.



Compensation



Hourly + performance bonus

OR



Lower hourly + strong per-appointment bonus



We will structure based on experience and performance.



Work Structure



4‚Äì5 days per week



3‚Äì5 hours per day (to start)



U.S. calling hours (Central Time Zone)



Trial period: 7 days paid test



If you perform, this becomes long-term.



To Apply



Reply with:



Your experience calling property owners (not just ‚Äúreal estate leads‚Äù)



Dialer systems you‚Äôve used



Your average daily dial count



Recording of one cold call (real estate related)



Your expected hourly rate



What do you say when an owner says:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not selling.‚Äù



Final Note



I work with serious owners and developers.

If you are confident, disciplined, and results-driven ‚Äî we will work well together.



If you need constant supervision or cannot handle rejection, this is not for you.

title: Remote Executive Assistant
description:
Position Overview:



 



At Ready Roles, we don‚Äôt just fill positions; we build lasting, impactful careers. As a Remote Executive Assistant, you will step into a critical role as a trusted ‚Äúright arm‚Äù for an American business owner, making an essential difference in their day-to-day and long-term success. We are looking for driven, proactive individuals who don‚Äôt wait for instructions but actively seek opportunities to make an impact.



 



This role is for self-starters who thrive on finding solutions, tackling new challenges, and staying one step ahead of the business owner‚Äôs needs. Ready Roles carefully vets every client to ensure a respectful, growth-oriented work environment where your contributions are valued. We‚Äôre looking for someone ready to build a future, grow their skills, and commit to long-term success with their client.



 



Why Join Ready Roles?



 



A Career Path, Not Just a Job: This isn‚Äôt a stepping-stone; it‚Äôs a role designed for long-term growth. We‚Äôre looking for candidates who are eager to build a stable career with a supportive company that invests in their future.



Independence and Opportunity to Lead: Our clients want self-driven assistants who identify opportunities for improvement, find ways to make the business run smoothly, and drive the organization forward without needing to be told what to do. You‚Äôll actively manage the business owner‚Äôs schedule and push organizational goals, not just your own tasks.



Respectful, Growth-Focused Clients: We only partner with clients who value stability and respect for their team. As a Ready Role, you‚Äôll work with a business owner who is committed to your success and who shares a long-term vision for growth.



 



Key Responsibilities:



 



1. Daily Management and Proactive Support:



Calendar and Schedule Management: Oversee and prioritize the CEO‚Äôs calendar, blocking time for high-priority tasks, scheduling meetings, and ensuring the CEO is fully prepared for each day.



 and Communication Oversight: Sort, prioritize, and respond to
s and messages, filtering essential information to keep the CEO focused and eliminating routine communication distractions.



Daily Check-Ins and Task Planning: Conduct a daily check-in with the CEO to review priorities, set action items, and address any immediate needs, keeping both the CEO and the team on track.



2. Self-Directed Task Identification:



Identify Areas to Add Value: Proactively seek out tasks or projects that align with business goals, whether improving internal processes, coordinating with tea
mbers, or streamlining workflows.



Manage and Anticipate Owner‚Äôs Needs: Track ongoing projects, follow up on open items, and keep the CEO informed on key updates and deadlines without needing reminders ?.



3. Organizational Efficiency and System Improvement:



Organize and Optimize Documents: Maintain organized digital files, project documents, and SOPs for easy access, updating materials as needed to support the company‚Äôs growth.



Monitor and Report on KPIs: Track, organize, and report key performance indicators as part of regular updates for the CEO, helping to keep the business aligned with its growth goals.



Drive Accountability with Tea
mbers: Follow up with tea
mbers on task completions and updates, and provide the CEO with regular summaries on team progress.



4. Push Owner‚Äôs Priorities and Support Growth:



Prepare for Strategic Initiatives: Ensure the CEO has the necessary information, prep materials, or background for high-priority meetings and business development initiatives.



Drive Daily and Weekly Agendas: Take ownership of setting daily and weekly agendas that push the company‚Äôs priorities forward, managing your tasks around the CEO‚Äôs most critical goals.



 



What We‚Äôre Looking For:



 



Self-Driven, Proactive Mindset - This role is for someone who naturally takes the initiative and actively finds ways to contribute. You‚Äôll be expected to add value without waiting for instructions and to be a driving force for the business.



Commitment to Long-Term Growth - Ready Roles is built on loyalty and stability. We‚Äôre looking for someone who values a long-term commitment, seeks stability, and is motivated to build a future with us and the business owner they support.



Aligned with Our Values - Ready Roles believes in accountability, respect, and integrity. We‚Äôre looking for someone who takes ownership of their work, consistently shows up with purpose, and is eager to create a lasting impact.



 



Qualifications:

title: Workflow Dispatch Coordinator
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a **Workflow Dispatch Coordinator** who understands the fast-moving world of fleet maintenance and can keep technicians, work orders, customers, and parts workflows running smoothly. This role requires someone who has **hands-on experience working in fleet maintenance or fleet management** and knows the real operational challenges behind keeping commercial vehicles on the road.



You will manage scheduling, technician dispatching, work order movement, parts coordination, and customer communication. If you‚Äôve worked inside a fleet shop, mobile fleet service, or high-volume automotive environment and know how to bring order to constant moving pieces, this role is for you.



---



Why You‚Äôll Want to Join



- Paid in USD twice monthly (15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays based on your location

- 100% remote setup with flexibility to work where you perform best

- Work directly with an operations team supporting fleet technicians across multiple states

- Build systems and structure in a rapidly scaling mobile fleet maintenance company



---



What You‚Äôll Work On



Technician Dispatching and Scheduling



- Assign work orders to technicians based on skill set, location, urgency, and availability

- Ensure technicians are routed and scheduled efficiently to minimize downtime

- Track technician progress throughout the day and adjust assignments as needed

- Monitor high-priority jobs and provide real-time updates to leadership and customers



Work Order and Workflow Management



- Move work orders through their lifecycle from scheduling to completion

- Verify documentation, technician notes, photos, and parts usage

- Ensure all required details are captured to support billing and internal records

- Flag missing information and follow up with technicians to close loops



Customer Coordination



- Communicate job status updates, scheduling adjustments, or technician ETAs

- Work with fleet managers to plan service windows and recurring maintenance

- Provide clear, timely communication around delays, parts issues, or emergencies



Parts and Vendor Coordination



- Collaborate with the Parts Manager on availability, delivery timing, or substitutions

- Monitor whether parts required for upcoming work orders are staged or in transit

- Coordinate with vendors when necessary to ensure technicians have what they need



Operational Tracking and Problem Solving



- Monitor daily workflow dashboards and flag bottlenecks

- Document operational issues and escalate when necessary

- Support the operations team with ad hoc projects that improve efficiency, clarity, and technician productivity



---



What You Bring



- **Must have:** Previous experience in **fleet maintenance or fleet management**

- Ideally **2 to 4 years** of experience in automotive service coordination, dispatching, repair shop operations, or similar

- **Automotive background required** ‚Äî you should understand vehicle maintenance terms, workflows, and job types

- Comfortable managing multiple moving parts in a fast-paced environment

- Strong communication skills with the ability to speak clearly to technicians, customers, and internal teams

- Highly organized with excellent follow-through

- Tech-comfortable and able to use scheduling software, workflow systems, or fleet management tools



Nice to Have



- Familiarity with tools like **HubSpot, ShopMonkey, Tekmetric, AutoLeap**

- Background supporting multi-state or multi-location service teams

- Familiarity with parts workflows or maintenance planning

- Ability to troubleshoot minor technical issues or documentation gaps



---



How to Apply



Please include:



1. Your **updated resume**

2. A **short 1‚Äì2 minute Loom video** explaining your fleet maintenance or dispatch experience and how you manage complex workflows



Only candidates who submit a Loom video will be considered.



---



If you understand the realities of fleet service, enjoy coordinating moving pieces, and can keep technicians and customers aligned throughout the day, this role gives you the chance to support a growing operations team at the center of vehicle uptime and customer trust.

title: Real Estate & Property Management Operations Assistant (Full-Time, U.S. Hours)
description:
Hi! I‚Äôm a U.S.-based Real Estate Agent and Vacation Rental Property Manager looking for a full-time Virtual Assistant who loves organization, systems, and helping keep a fast-moving business running smoothly.



This is NOT a basic VA role. I need someone who is highly reliable, detail-focused, and comfortable working inside CRMs, documents, reports, and social media scheduling tools.



You will be my right-hand support person helping with both my real estate business and my short-term rental management.

Monday ‚Äì Friday

10:00 AM ‚Äì 6:00 PM CST (U.S. Central Time)

You must be comfortable working U.S. daytime hours and communicating in real time.



Responsibilities



Real Estate Agent Support

Draft Buyer‚Äôs Agreements and send to clients

Update CRM notes and maintain clean records

Maintain spreadsheets and tracking systems

Communicate with inbound leads to schedule appointments

Follow up with buyers and sellers after meetings

Update inbound sales team on lead progress

Research properties that may be strong short-term rental investments

Create and schedule social media content (static posts & Reels)



Vacation Rental / Property Management Support

Create new digital house manuals and Canva guidebooks

Research local dining, attractions, events, and activities

Create digital slides for property guides

Run weekly KPI performance reports

Check new reservations for accuracy

Prepare end-of-month owner reports and invoicing

Assist with guest messaging when needed



This is not a basic assistant role. I‚Äôm looking for a detail-driven operations partner who enjoys building structure, maintaining systems, and keeping a fast-moving real estate and property management business organized.



You will thrive here if you:

* Prefer clear processes and checklists

* Like keeping CRMs accurate and organized

* Take pride in completing tasks correctly the first time

* Communicate clearly and consistently

* Are comfortable working independently during U.S. business hours

I move quickly and think big-picture, so I need someone who enjoys execution, follow-through, and making sure nothing falls through the cracks.



If you are someone who enjoys turning busy workflows into smooth systems, this role will feel natural to you.



Tools You May Work With

CRM system (Lofty)

Dotloop

Canva / CapCut

Google Workspace

Social media platforms 
 & Instagram)

Vacation Rental Management Software (OwnerRez)



This role is best suited for someone who is naturally organized, detail-focused, and consistent. If you enjoy structured work, keeping systems updated, and supporting a fast-paced business behind the scenes, you will be a strong fit.



To confirm you read this entire post, start your application with the words ‚ÄúSYSTEMS FIRST‚Äù and include one example of a Reel you personally created and one CRM you have actively used. Applications without this will not be reviewed.



This is a full-time role requiring active availability during U.S. daytime hours. If you are currently working multiple full-time roles, this position will not be a fit.



How to Apply

Please include:

A short intro about your real estate VA experience

Tools you‚Äôve used (CRM, Canva, video editing, etc.)

A sample Reel or social media post you created

Confirmation that you can work 10 AM ‚Äì 6 PM Central Time Zone

- CRM Management: Keep detailed, accurate records of outreach activity, follow-ups, and prospect interactions within the CRM.

- Process Building & Optimization: Develop, refine, and scale processes for efficient and high-touch outbound engagement.



Qualifications:

- Experience in outbound sales, lead generation, or a similar role is preferred.

- Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail.

- Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding outreach and pipeline targets.

title: Full Time Sales Administrator
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a full-time Sales Administrator to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.







***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********







About Us



Started in 2017 and we're growing like crazy.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2024 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2025.

A small team of 1 American and 9 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don‚Äôt do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive compensation package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid Two weeks off for Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you‚Äôre looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

We will train you on how to take customers through the sales process.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Leads Processing - Import into CRM, enroll in follow-up sequences with the sales team

Delayed AFC Activity Check - Check to see why leads haven‚Äôt been followed up with

Duplicate Record Check - Make sure there are no duplicate sales leads in the CRM

Unqualified Lead Check - Make sure we‚Äôre not following up with unqualified leads

CTM Prospect Staging - Edit lead records in our phone system for the sales team

Out of Sequence Check - Make sure all leads are in a follow-up sequence with the sales team

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT . This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Order Confirmation - Initial OC (Level 1 and Level 3) - Transfer order details from scheduling and payment systems into our CRM

Follow Up on Unconfirmed Orders (Ordinary) - Contact customers and instructors to make sure they talk to each other.





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to Multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experienced with lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINKELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.



Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.
