title: Real Estate Inside Sales Agent
description:
Real Estate Virtual Assistant - Full-Time Inside Sales Agent

(Must have prior real estate experience)



Our St. Louis, MO, USA-based Real Estate Investments company, with over a decade in real estate investing, is seeking a dedicated and experienced real estate professional to join our growing team! If you enjoy negotiating deals, have a proven track record in real estate sales, and are looking for a remote opportunity where you can make an impact, please read the details and apply below by reading the how to apply instructions.



Job Description:

We are hiring for the position of Real Estate Inside Sales Agent. In this role, you will work remotely and be responsible for speaking with homeowners, gathering property information, negotiating offers, and securing contracts for our investment properties. Your main focus will be on acquiring distressed properties at favorable terms by getting property info, making offers, negotiating deals, and diligently following up to close sales. You will use your sales expertise and relationship-building skills to engage potential sellers, gather necessary information, and document interactions in our CRM system.



Responsibilities:

- Conduct outbound calls and send
s to manage real estate buying opportunities.

- Make offers to potential sellers and negotiate terms to get our offers accepted.

- Follow up on all leads and negotiations to ensure deal closure.

- Utilize effective sales strategies and scripts to handle objections and convey our company‚Äôs value proposition.

- Maintain detailed records of all interactions and negotiations in our CRM system.

- Collaborate with other tea
mbers to ensure seamless transaction processes.



Qualifications:

- High Energy and Enthusiastic Personality: You thrive in a fast-paced, engaging environment.

- 2+ Years of Real Estate Sales and Negotiations Experience: Proven background in closing deals.

- Exceptional English Communication Skills: Fluent in both written and verbal English.

- Fearless Negotiator: Eager to engage in challenging conversations, overcome objections, and secure agreements.

- Organized and Detail-Oriented: Excellent time management skills.

- Technologically Proficient: Experience using CRM systems and quick to learn new technologies.

- Problem Solver: Ability to navigate complex negotiations effectively.



System Requirements:

- Reliable high-speed laptop or desktop computer.

- DSL Internet connection with a minimum speed of 40+ Mbps.

- Noise-canceling headset.

- Must have a dedicated quiet home office setup



Performance Metrics:

- Talk to a certain number of sellers daily, weekly, and monthly.

- Achieve a target number of accepted offers each month.

- Consistently follow up to close deals within expected timeframes.



Career Growth & Training:

- Opportunities for advancement into leadership roles for high-performing individuals.

- Professional training provided to enhance your skills.



Company Culture:

- Dynamic and Collaborative: We value teamwork, integrity, and a drive for excellence.

- Supportive Environment: We believe in ongoing professional growth and celebrating achievements.

- High Ethical Standards: We conduct business with honesty and transparency.



What We‚Äôre Looking For:

- Self-motivated professionals with a positive attitude.

- Candidates with a dedicated home office setup.

- Ability to thrive in a remote role with excellent time management skills.

- Experience in real estate sales



What We‚Äôre Not Looking For:

- Candidates who cannot commit to our specified working hours: Monday to Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM CST.

- Minimal Communication Skills: If you struggle with fluent English communication, both written and verbal.

- Lack of Self-Motivation and Enthusiasm.

- Candidates unfamiliar with CRMs and resistant to learning new systems or scripts.

- Candidates with inconsistent internet and power supply or a disruptive workspace.

- Candidates who are easily flustered, shy, or fearful when making calls.

- Offline or Non-Voice Preference: This is a phone-based sales position.



Pay Rate:

Starting up to $6/hr, with performance bonuses. Pay is issued on the 1st and 15th of each month (CST).



Working Hours:

Monday to Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM CST. A 30-minute lunch break and two 15-minute breaks per shift.



How to Apply: (Submit Your Resume and Introduction)

-
 your updated resume and a brief personalized audio or video recording to: 

- Use the subject line "Real Estate Application - Inside Sales Agent"

- In your recording, introduce yourself and explain why you are a great fit for this role.

- Attach a recent internet speed test result and a photo of your home office setup to verify your system readiness.



= Important Note: Only complete applications that follow all the instructions will be considered. We look forward to reviewing your application! =

title: N8N Systems Operator (Part-Time)
description:

This role requires confidence with VPS hosting, installation, updates, integrations, and workflow troubleshooting. You will be responsible for managing system performance, automations, and backend connections across our tech stack.



You will also assist with automation tasks inside Go High Level, Apollo, Instantly, Calendly, Notion, and ClickUp. You can work your normal schedule, however some overlap for occasional USA based meetings is helpful.



Key Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Set up and launch a self hosted N8N instance on a VPS

‚Ä¢ Configure domains, SSL, environment variables, and security settings

‚Ä¢ Maintain updates, version control, and system reliability

‚Ä¢ Build and troubleshoot automation workflows inside N8N

‚Ä¢ Connect platforms using APIs, webhooks, and integration logic

‚Ä¢ Assist with Go High Level workflows and automation settings

‚Ä¢ Support Apollo, Instantly, and Calendly connections

‚Ä¢ Monitor automations for errors and resolve issues quickly

‚Ä¢ Document processes and maintain clear technical notes



Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Proven experience launching or managing a self hosted N8N setup

‚Ä¢ Experience working with VPS platforms such as DigitalOcean, Linode, Vultr, or similar

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Docker or container based deployments

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of APIs, JSON, and webhook integrations

‚Ä¢ Experience with Go High Level automation tools

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Apollo, Instantly, and Calendly

‚Ä¢ Reliable problem solving skills and attention to detail

‚Ä¢ Clear written and spoken English

‚Ä¢ Able to join occasional meetings with USA based tea
mbers



Preferred Skills



‚Ä¢ Experience improving or rebuilding automation workflows

‚Ä¢ Experience using Notion and ClickUp

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with AI tools that support workflow creation



Compensation

Pay is negotiable based on experience.



Application Process

To apply for this role, candidates MUST complete all of the following steps:

 1. Submit a resume outlining your relevant experience.

 2. Provide links, screenshots, or examples of automation or self hosted work you have completed.

 3. Submit a newly recorded video stating the current date and explaining your experience with N8N and self hosted systems.



Applications must be submitted through this link: 
/4130RpL

title: Short Form Video Uploader and Platform Manager for YouTube Instagram and TikTok
description:
Title

Short Form Video Uploader and Platform Manager for YouTube Instagram and TikTok



Description

I am looking for a reliable and detail oriented person to manage daily short form video uploads across YouTube Instagram and TikTok.



This is a long term role. At the start, you will upload one video per day to each platform using the same video. Over time, upload volume will increase significantly across platforms.



This role is focused on execution, consistency, and attention to detail. You must understand how short form platforms work and how to publish content correctly for reach and clicks.



What You Will Do

‚Ä¢ Upload short form videos to YouTube Instagram and TikTok

‚Ä¢ Ensure correct formatting for each platform

‚Ä¢ Choose audio when required that correctly matches the vibe and message of the video

‚Ä¢ Write titles optimized for maximum clicks and engagement

‚Ä¢ Write captions that sound human and natural even if AI is used

‚Ä¢ Ensure captions and titles feel intentional and premium

‚Ä¢ Schedule and publish content consistently every day

‚Ä¢ Follow platform best practices for short form content

‚Ä¢ Handle increased upload volume as the account scales



Important Style Rules

‚Ä¢ Captions must sound human and natural

‚Ä¢ No robotic or generic AI language

‚Ä¢ Absolutely no dashes used in titles or captions

‚Ä¢ Clean professional tone at all times



Requirements

‚Ä¢ Experience uploading short form content to YouTube Instagram and TikTok

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of how titles affect clicks and reach

‚Ä¢ Ability to choose audio that fits the mood and message of a video

‚Ä¢ Strong English writing skills

‚Ä¢ High attention to detail

‚Ä¢ Reliable daily availability

‚Ä¢ Organized and consistent



Proof Required

Please include proof of accounts you have uploaded content for or managed.

Applications without proof will not be considered.



WORK SCHEDULE AND PAY



Starting Phase

‚Ä¢ 7 days a week

‚Ä¢ Approximately 1 hour per day

‚Ä¢ Pay is $4 per hour



Scale Phase

As upload volume increases

‚Ä¢ 7 days a week

‚Ä¢ Approximately 2 hours per day

‚Ä¢ Pay increases to $6 per hour



Further Scaling

If uploads increase beyond this workload

‚Ä¢ Daily hours will be adjusted

‚Ä¢ Pay will be adjusted based on workload and performance



This is a long term role with consistent daily work for the right person.

title: Data Extraction and Automation Specialist
description:
Company Overview



We are seeking a skilled Data Extraction and Automation Specialist who understands modern web scraping, lead data enrichment, automation workflows, and structured data management. Availability during U.S. Eastern hours is required.



Position Overview



We are hiring a Web Scraping and Lead Data Automation Specialist to support advanced list building, structured data extraction, and enrichment workflows. This role focuses on pulling targeted lead data at scale using Apify, Python, Clay, and APIs.



This is a hands on technical role for someone who understands scraping logic, selectors, pagination, anti-bot challenges, deduplication, and data normalization.



Key Responsibilities



‚Ä¢ Build and maintain lead scraping workflows using Apify actors or Python

‚Ä¢ Extract structured data from websites, directories, databases, and public sources

‚Ä¢ Handle pagination, login flows, rate limits, and anti-scraping mechanisms

‚Ä¢ Clean, dedupe, and normalize datasets

‚Ä¢ Enrich scraped data using Clay

‚Ä¢ Connect scraped and enriched data to CRM systems, Google Sheets, or CSV exports

‚Ä¢ Build or integrate APIs for data transfer when needed

‚Ä¢ Document scraping workflows and error handling processes

‚Ä¢ Monitor automation health and troubleshoot broken workflows

‚Ä¢ Deliver clean, structured lead lists ready for outbound campaigns



Qualifications



‚Ä¢ Proven experience with web scraping using Apify or Python

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of HTML, CSS selectors, DOM structure

‚Ä¢ Experience handling structured data formats such as JSON, CSV, and Excel

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with REST APIs and authentication methods

‚Ä¢ Experience using Clay for data enrichment

‚Ä¢ Ability to troubleshoot scraping failures and adjust extraction logic

‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills and documentation habits

‚Ä¢ Availability during U.S. Eastern hours



Preferred Skills



‚Ä¢ Experience scraping education, healthcare, legal, or local business databases

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with n8n, Zapier, or Make

‚Ä¢ Experience integrating scraped data into Instantly, Apollo, Go High Level, or other CRMs

‚Ä¢ Understanding of proxy management and anti-bot mitigation



Compensation



Pay is negotiable based on experience and technical depth.



Application Process



To apply for this position, candidates MUST complete all of the following steps:

 1. Submit a resume outlining web scraping and automation experience.

 2. Upload examples or screenshots of previous scraping projects or data extraction workflows.

 3. Submit a newly recorded video introduction where you:

‚Ä¢ State the current date

‚Ä¢ Explain your experience with web scraping, Apify, Python, and Clay

‚Ä¢ Describe a scraping workflow you built and how you handled errors or blocked requests



Important Application Instructions



‚Ä¢ Applications must be submitted through this link: 
/4130RpL

‚Ä¢ Applications submitted directly on other platforms will not be reviewed

‚Ä¢ All steps must be completed to be considered

title: Video Editor Needed ‚Äî Motion Graphics and Explainer Videos (AI and Blockchain Content)
description:
Job Type: Part time, per video basis

Payment: Per video rate, all work paid at the end of each month

Niche: AI, Blockchain, and Technology

About the Role

We run a growing YouTube channel focused on AI and blockchain content. We need a skilled video editor who specializes in motion graphics and explainer style videos. Our content breaks down complex topics like artificial intelligence, blockchain infrastructure, decentralized networks, and automation. The editing needs to make these concepts visually engaging and easy to understand for a broad audience.

This is an ongoing role. We publish consistently and need a reliable editor who can grow with the channel.

What You Will Be Editing

Explainer and educational videos (8 to 15 minutes) breaking down AI and blockchain concepts with clean motion graphics, animated text, diagrams, and visual storytelling. Think channels like Fireship, ColdFusion, or Slidebean level visual quality.

What We Are Looking For

Strong motion graphics skills (After Effects, Premiere Pro, or similar)

Experience creating animated explainers, data visualizations, or tech style content

Ability to take a voiceover or talking head and turn it into a visually rich, engaging video

Clean typography and smooth transitions

Understanding of pacing and storytelling for educational content

Reliable communication and ability to meet deadlines

Bonus if you have experience editing AI or crypto related content

What To Include In Your Application

Links to 2 to 3 videos you have edited that showcase your motion graphics and explainer work

Your per video rate for an 8 to 15 minute video with motion graphics throughout

Your typical turnaround time per video

A short note on your editing process and tools you use

Payment Terms

You will be paid per video at an agreed upon flat rate. All payments are made at the end of each month for work delivered that month.

We are looking for someone long term who wants to build with us as the channel grows. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.????????????????

title: Senior WordPress Developer
description:
About Zed Studio

- Zed Studio is a strategy-led digital studio based near Cambridge, UK. We build high-performing, conversion-focused websites for ambitious businesses across travel, property, sustainability, trades and retail.

- We care deeply about quality, detail and long-term results. We‚Äôre not a high-volume agency. We focus on doing things properly and building strong relationships with our clients.

- We‚Äôre now looking for a Senior WordPress Developer to grow with us. This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to take real ownership and be part of an evolving studio.

- For the right person, this role has the potential to grow into a full time role/leadership position as the business expands.



The Role

- You‚Äôll be responsible for building high-quality WordPress websites from approved Figma designs using Elementor.

- We‚Äôre looking for someone who is comfortable working independently, confident interpreting designs accurately, and able to use their judgement when refining layouts across breakpoints.

- You won‚Äôt be micromanaged, but you will be supported. We value initiative, thoughtful problem solving and strong attention to detail.



Key Responsibilities

- Build full WordPress websites from Figma designs using Elementor

- Ensure responsive layouts are well considered across desktop, tablet and mobile

- Create new pages within existing design systems confidently

- Apply custom CSS or light HTML where needed to achieve accuracy

- Maintain performance, structure and technical quality

- Implement ongoing improvements and enhancements to live websites

- Manage plugin integrations and troubleshoot issues

- Support monthly updates and ongoing improvements

- Collaborate via ClickUp and Slack

- Contribute ideas that improve efficiency, usability or performance



What Good Looks Like

- Clean, accurate builds with minimal revision cycles

- Strong attention to spacing, alignment and consistency

- Clear and timely communication with early issue flagging

- Responsive layouts that feel considered, not adjusted as an afterthought

- Thoughtful improvements suggested when appropriate

- Increasing autonomy and ownership over time



Required Experience

- 5+ years professional WordPress experience

- Advanced Elementor knowledge

- Strong HTML and CSS skills

- Experience working from Figma or similar design tools

- Good understanding of responsive behaviour

- WooCommerce familiarity

- Performance optimisation knowledge



Bonus Experience

- ACF and custom post types

- SEO best practice familiarity

- Design flare and experience with design software

- HighLevel experience

- Automation tools such as Zapier

- Light JavaScript or PHP

- Agency or freelance experience managing multiple builds

- Well versed in AI, using the latest tools to speed up their work flow whilst maintaining quality and authenticity



Who we‚Äôre looking for

- Naturally detail-oriented

- Takes pride in high-quality execution

- Comfortable working independently

- Proactive and solution-focused

- Communicates clearly and early

- Interested in growing within a small, ambitious studio



Structure

- Approximately 20 hours per week initially

- Scope to increase hours as the business grows

- Remote role

- Availability during UK business hours preferred



Application Requirements

Requirements:

- A computer less than three years old

- Reliable internet connection with a backup solution

- Headset or microphone for tea
etings



Availability for regular check-ins during UK business hours



Please include the following with your application:

- 2 to 3 live WordPress websites you have personally built

- A short explanation of your role in each project

- Confirmation of whether the site was built from Figma or another design file



We‚Äôre particularly interested in examples where you were responsible for the full build and responsive refinement.



Please note: Applications should only be submitted through the official job listing website. Please do not apply directly through Zed Studio or via
.

title: Email Marketing Manager / Klaviyo Specialist (Email + SMS) ‚Äì Ecommerce / Shopify
description:
APPLY HERE:

Please submit a Google Form: 



We are an ecommerce brand hiring an experienced
 Marketing Manager to own our retention marketing across
 and SMS. This is a hands-on role responsible for planning, writing, building, launching, and optimizing campaigns and automations. You must be confident working inside Klaviyo and Shopify, and you should have experience running SMS using any major platform (Klaviyo SMS, Postscript, Attentive, SMSBump/Yotpo SMS, or similar).



You will work closely with a graphic designer (or our design team) to produce high-converting, on-brand
 creatives. You will be responsible for writing clear briefs for design, assembling
s in Klaviyo, QA, scheduling, segmentation, testing, reporting, and continuous improvement.



Responsibilities:

- Own the
 and SMS channel end-to-end: strategy, execution, testing, and performance reporting

- Build and optimize Klaviyo flows (welcome series, abandoned cart/checkout, browse abandonment, post-purchase, winback, upsell/cross-sell, back-in-stock)

- Plan and send weekly campaign calendars (promotions, education, product angles, social proof, seasonal messaging)

- Write
 and SMS copy that matches the brand voice and converts (subject lines, preheaders, body copy, CTAs, SMS messages)

- Research customer pains, objections, and buying triggers using reviews, support tickets, surveys, competitor research, and website analytics

- Create clear briefs for an
 graphic designer (goal, segment, offer, message hierarchy, required blocks, CTA/link map, references, deadline)

- Build
s in Klaviyo using modular templates and dynamic content when needed

- Manage segmentation, exclusions, and suppression rules (including cross-channel timing to avoid over-messaging)

- Monitor deliverability and list health (engagement, unsubscribes, complaints, list cleaning/sunset strategy)

- Run A/B tests and apply learnings (subject lines, offers, creative angles, send times, segmentation)

- Track and report performance (revenue per recipient, conversion rate, CTR, unsubscribe rate, flow performance, incremental lift tests when possible)

- Coordinate with customer support and operations when needed (shipping delays, product issues, FAQs that impact messaging)



Requirements:

- Proven experience as an
 Marketing Manager, Retention/CRM Manager, or Klaviyo Specialist for Shopify ecommerce brands

- Strong Klaviyo skills: flows, segmentation, templates, campaign setup, dynamic content basics, reporting

- SMS experience using any major SMS platform (Klaviyo SMS, Postscript, Attentive, SMSBump/Yotpo SMS, or similar)

- Ability to brief designers clearly and manage creative production deadlines

- Detail-oriented QA mindset (links, tracking, mobile formatting, personalization fallbacks, suppressions)

- Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and communicate updates consistently



Nice to Have:

- Experience with CRO, landing pages, or offer testing



To Apply:

Please submit a Google Form:

title: Virtual Assistant (Short-Term Rentals) - Remote (must work some UK hours)
description:
Hostroo - Virtual Assistant (Short-Term Rentals) - Remote (must work some UK hours)



Location: Remote (role supports operations in London time zone).



Type: Full-time (shift patterns negotiable). Weekend availability required. Career path into Lead VA.



About us

We‚Äôre Hostroo, a London-based short-term rental management business focused on high-quality guest experiences and fast operational delivery. We‚Äôre scaling our team and want a hardworking, detail-obsessed Virtual Assistant who can own guest communication, cleaning & maintenance coordination, and general admin - with a clear path to lead other VAs and management.



Role summary

This is a hands-on VA role. You will be the day-to-day point of contact for guests, manage cleaners and maintenance contractors, and support Directors on ad-hoc projects. The right candidate will be promoted to Lead VA after meeting clear KPIs and demonstrating supervisory skills.



Key responsibilities:

1) Guest communication: Respond to enquiries, pre-arrival messages, FAQs, check-in/check-out support, and complaint resolution across Airbnb and our phone line during your shift. Escalate complex issues to Directors.

2) Cleaning management: Schedule/confirm cleaners, perform quality checks, manage turnovers for back-to-back bookings.

3) Maintenance coordination: Log maintenance issues, assign contractors, track progress, and keep guests updated until resolution.

4) Admin & ad-hoc projects: Support Directors with small projects (data updates, property onboarding, SOP creation).

5) Record keeping: Update property logs, contractor records, i
 reports and cleaning checklists.





Success metrics / KPIs

- First response to guest messages during shift: around 30 minutes (SLA).

- Guest satisfaction / review score: maintain average:4.8.

- Maintenance acknowledged within 2 hours and resolved or progressed as per priority matrix.

- Accuracy of checklists, logs and handovers: <2% errors.



Schedule & hours

Must be available on weekends (rotating weekend shifts possible). Example shift patterns: UK mornings (07:00-12:00 GMT) or evenings (16:00-21:00 GMT). We‚Äôll agree to fixed shifts at hire.



* Candidates should state their preferred shift and confirm no conflicting full-time commitments.



What we‚Äôre looking for (must-haves)

- Excellent written and spoken English (professional tone, flawless grammar).

- Problem solver: calm under pressure, clear judgement, decisive escalation.

- Reliable internet and workstation (fast, stable connection).

- Comfortable with phone calls (we use virtual landline systems) and chat platforms (Slack/WhatsApp).

- Good organisation - follows checklists and documents everything.

- Weekend availability.



Nice-to-have

- Experience managing 
/VRBO messages or property management platforms.

- Experience coordinating cleaners and contractors.

- Basic spreadsheet skills (Google Sheets).



Pay & progression

Competitive compensation with regular pay reviews and performance bonuses. There is a structured path to become Lead VA (training, responsibilities, documented promotion criteria, and quarterly reviews). Exact pay will be discussed at interview; strong performers see regular increases and leadership opportunities.





How to apply

Please submit the following in a single Google Drive link or file attachment:

1) Resume (PDF).

2) 1-minute intro video (MP4 or link) - tell us your name, location, and why you‚Äôd be a great VA.

3) Recent internet speed test screenshot/result dated within the last 14 days.

4) Your preferred shift(s) and whether you can work weekends.

5) Paste your written reply (max 150 words) to this guest message:

‚ÄúI just got your message asking for a damage deposit before I check in. This is ridiculous - I booked weeks ago and there was no mention of this in the listing. You can‚Äôt just ask for money last minute. If you try to take money from my card I‚Äôll report you and leave a bad review. Explain immediately and what you are going to do about it!‚Äù



Why join Hostroo

- Clear, documented career path to Lead VA and beyond.

- Real responsibility from day one - not just admin.

- Regular pay reviews and performance bonuses.

- Training & SOP library to level you up.

title: Remote Support Technician (Level 2)
description:
Remote Support Technician (Level 2)

Work From Home  ‚Ä¢  Philippines-Based  ‚Ä¢  No Phone Required

Elevatus is a U.S.-based managed IT services provider looking for a skilled, detail-oriented Level 2 Support Technician to join our team remotely from the Philippines. This is a work-from-home position with no client-facing phone calls ‚Äî you will handle backend technical support tasks that keep our clients‚Äô environments running smoothly while our Frontline Engineers focus on direct client relationships.



If you have MSP experience, take pride in doing clean, thorough work, and want to be part of a collaborative team that values people as much as technical skill, we want to hear from you.



About Elevatus IT

We are a managed IT services company built on two things: technical excellence and genuine care for the people we serve. Our team is made up of skilled, personable engineers who work together ‚Äî not in isolation. We believe our greatest strength is our people and how they collaborate. We currently have two Philippines-based tea
mbers who have each been part of the Elevatus IT family for nearly three years. This role is an expansion of that success ‚Äî not an experiment. When you join Elevatus IT, you are not just filling a seat. You are becoming part of a team that has each other‚Äôs backs.



The Role

As a Remote Support Technician, you will work from a dedicated ticket queue handling process-driven, repeatable tasks that do not require direct interaction with end users. Your work frees up our client-facing engineers to focus on relationships and real-time support, while you ensure the back-end work gets done right.



This is not a call center position. There are no phone calls. Client interaction, if any, is limited to occasional
 for resolution verification. The majority of your work is independent execution of documented procedures with access to a collaborative team when you need support.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing

‚Ä¢ Assessing
 legitimacy (phishing analysis, header review, SPF/DKIM/DMARC checks)

‚Ä¢ Whitelisting and blacklisting
 addresses and domains in
 security platforms

‚Ä¢ Onboarding new users: creating accounts, assigning licenses, configuring mailboxes, setting group memberships

‚Ä¢ Offboarding departing users: disabling accounts, revoking access, converting mailboxes, removing licenses

‚Ä¢ Password resets with secure delivery methods

‚Ä¢ MFA enrollment resets and user re-enrollment coordination

‚Ä¢ Shared mailbox creation, permissions management, and calendar configuration

‚Ä¢ Distribution list and security group management

‚Ä¢
 forwarding rules and auto-reply configuration

‚Ä¢ Quarantine management and spam filter adjustments

‚Ä¢ Maintaining accurate ticket documentation and time entries

‚Ä¢ Updating client documentation when discrepancies are found

‚Ä¢ Identifying runbook gaps and recommending improvements



What We‚Äôre Looking For



Required

‚Ä¢ Minimum 2 years of experience in IT support at a Level 2 capacity or above

‚Ä¢ Strong working knowledge of Microsoft 365 administration (user management, Exchange Online, Entra ID, licensing)

‚Ä¢ Experience with Active Directory (account creation, group management, password administration)

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of
 security concepts (SPF, DKIM, DMARC, phishing identification)

‚Ä¢ Excellent written English ‚Äî professional, clear, and grammatically correct

‚Ä¢ Reliable high-speed internet and a dedicated, private home workspace

‚Ä¢ Willingness to work a schedule that includes a minimum 4-hour overlap with U.S. Eastern Time business hours

‚Ä¢ Self-motivated and disciplined ‚Äî able to manage your own queue and time without constant supervision

‚Ä¢ Strong documentation habits ‚Äî you believe in writing things down thoroughly and clearly



Huge Plus

‚Ä¢ Prior MSP / Managed Service Provider experience. If you‚Äôve worked in an MSP environment, you already understand the pace, the tools, and the multi-client reality of this work. This is a significant advantage.

‚Ä¢ Experience with PSA/ticketing systems (Autotask, ConnectWise, or similar)

‚Ä¢ Experience with documentation platforms (ITGlue, Hudu, or similar)

‚Ä¢ Experience with
 security platforms (AppRiver, Proofpoint, Barracuda, or similar)

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with compliance frameworks (HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOC 2, CMMC)

‚Ä¢ Experience with RMM tools (N-central, NinjaOne, ConnectWise Automate, or similar)



What We Offer

‚Ä¢ Work from home ‚Äî permanently. This is not a temporary remote arrangement. This role is designed to be fully remote.

‚Ä¢ A real team. You are not an outsourced resource sitting in a silo. You will join two existing Philippines-based tea
mbers who have been with us for nearly three years each. You will be part of our daily communication, have access to the same escalation support as our local engineers, and be treated as a full member of the team.

‚Ä¢ Clear expectations and support. We provide detailed runbooks, thorough documentation, and a collaborative culture where asking for help is encouraged ‚Äî not penalized.

‚Ä¢ Growth potential. As you demonstrate proficiency and reliability, your scope and responsibilities can expand.

‚Ä¢ Structured onboarding. We do not throw you into the deep end. You will go through a supervised onboarding process with clear milestones before handling tickets independently.



What This Role Is Not

We want to be upfront so we attract the right candidates:



‚Ä¢ This is not a phone support role. You will never make or receive client phone calls.

‚Ä¢ This is not a help desk / Level 1 role. We expect Level 2 technical proficiency from day one.

‚Ä¢ This is not unsupervised freelancing. You will work set hours, follow established procedures, and be accountable to performance metrics.

‚Ä¢ This is not an overnight data entry position. This is real technical work that requires real technical skill and judgment.



How to Apply

Send us your resume and a brief cover letter. In your cover letter, tell us:

1.  Your experience with Microsoft 365 administration and Active Directory.

2.  Whether you have MSP experience, and if so, which tools and PSA/RMM platforms you‚Äôve used.

3.  Your available working hours and how they overlap with U.S. Eastern Time.

4.  A brief description of your home workspace setup (internet speed, dedicated space, power backup if applicable).

We review every application personally. If your background is a good fit, we‚Äôll be in touch.

title: Customer Operations Agent - Fintech Company
description:
If you‚Äôre a Customer Operations Agent leader in fintech/lending and want to join a startup with major career growth opportunities, this role is for you! 

Apply Here: 
/appqyBZJyyxs1htVk/pagYg48MNpIqaV148/form



As a Customer Operations Agent, you‚Äôll be the friendly, trusted face of our brand‚Äîsupporting customers with empathy and clarity whether they‚Äôre managing payments, reporting fraud, or simply need guidance. You‚Äôll be a founding member of the Customer Service team and will play an increasingly important role as it grows.



This role is ideal for someone who started their career as a customer service agent and progressed into a leadership or management position, gaining hands-on experience while helping teams scale. Experience working with or within major financial institutions or fintechs such as Wells Fargo, JP Morgan, Starling Bank, or similar organizations is highly valued. We‚Äôre looking for someone who can bring both frontline expertise and leadership mindset to help shape our customer operations from the ground up.



IMPORTANT: Please carefully read the responsibilities below to ensure you're a good fit, and follow the instructions on how to apply at the bottom.



Compensation:

* Competitive salary: $1,200 ‚Äì $1,400 USD per month (depending on experience)

* Opportunity to grow into a Team Lead/Manager position (with a raise) as the support team expands



Benefits:

* 100% Remote - work from anywhere in the Philippines.

* 15 days paid leave

* Bi-weekly salary payouts

* Paid time off and Philippine public holiday, listed here

* Supportive, startup-style culture where your ideas matter

* Clear growth path and strong learning opportunities in fintech



Working Hours:

* Training and Onboarding - Monday - Friday: 10 AM ‚Äì 5 PM UK time (6:00 PM ‚Äì 1:00 AM PH time)

* Normal shift schedule will be determined after training and onboarding

* Must be comfortable working during the weekends with weekdays rest days

* This is a full time role only (40 hours per week)



Core Responsibilities

* Deliver exceptional multi-channel support (chat,
, and phone) with a focus on first-contact resolution and high customer satisfaction.

* Uphold brand standards by communicating clearly, consistently, and professionally in all interactions.

* Actively manage brand reputation by professionally responding to all customer reviews and public feedback.

* Handle and resolve customer complaints with empathy and efficiency, knowing when and how to appropriately escalate complex issues.

* Oversee customer repayments and collections by assisting with payment management, rescheduling, and account oversight with professionalism and care.

* Protect the business by proactively identifying, investigating, and escalating suspicious activity and potential fraud cases.

* Leverage AI-driven tools to streamline workflows, optimize response times, and enhance the quality of support delivered.

* Drive continuous improvement by gathering and sharing actionable customer insights with product and internal teams to enhance offerings and processes.



You‚Äôre Perfect for This Role If You

* Have proven experience in customer service, ideally within fintech, payments, or * lending (BNPL experience a plus).

* Understand fraud detection, repayments, and collections, with empathy for customers‚Äô financial situations.

* Communicate effectively across chat,
, and phone, adapting tone and approach to each channel.

* Are tech-savvy and comfortable using AI tools and automation to streamline work.

* Thrive in a fast-paced, customer-first startup environment where priorities shift quickly.

* Are an empathetic problem solver with strong attention to detail, professionalism, and integrity.



How to Apply:

* Click the link below to submit your application and let's get started: 
/appqyBZJyyxs1htVk/pagYg48MNpIqaV148/form

title: Freelance / Part-time Copywriter
description:
Freelance / Part-time Copywriter 

Trident Digital | Singapore

Freelance | Remote Setup/Work from Home

Our usual working hours:  9am‚Äì6pm SGT



About the Role

Trident Digital is looking for one freelance Copywriter to join our ads team.

This role focuses mainly on copywriting for ads. You‚Äôll be supporting our Ads Manager so they can focus on higher-level strategy, testing, and scaling.

If you enjoy writing ad copy, this role will suit you well.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Copywriting

- Write and refine ad copy for Meta campaigns

- Create variations for headlines, primary text, hooks, and CTAs

- Improve existing ads based on performance data

- Work closely with creatives and strategists to align messaging



Collaboration

- Communicate closely with the Ads Manager, creatives, and project team

- Evaluate ad creatives and copy drafts before launch

- Support ad-hoc tasks related to ads and performance tracking



What We‚Äôre Looking For

Must-haves:

- Strong English copywriting skills (especially for ads)

- Basic to intermediate experience with Meta Ads (YouTube is a bonus)

- Detail-oriented and organised

- Able to follow processes and timelines

- Reliable and proactive in communication

- Nice to have (but not required):

- Experience writing ads for finance, real estate, or service-based businesses



Who This Role Is For

This role is ideal if you:

- Enjoy writing ads more than building funnels

- Prefer working behind the scenes while still contributing to results

- Comfortable supporting a lead Ads Manager rather than owning strategy



How to Apply

1. Please complete the test task found at the link below:



2.
 your application to 
 with the subject line:

Application ‚Äì Ad Copywriter ‚Äì [Your Name]

3. Your
 should include:

- Your completed test task (submitted in PDF format or via a viewable link accessible to anyone with the link)

- Your updated resume

- Your portfolio (link or PDF)

- Your rate per deliverable for the following: Landing Page (LP) draft, Video Ad and VSL Scripts, and Ad Copy



Note: Incomplete applications will not be considered.

title: Life Manager (Executive Assistant) - Remote Full Time
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire a life manager to support our agency and founder with the agency‚Äôs day-to-day operations



This is not a personal assistant role and not a traditional executive assistant role



You will help design, manage, and run systems across both work and personal life so everything operates smoothly, predictably, and with minimal mental overhead



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to reduce decision fatigue, improve organization, and create leverage through systems, structure, and proactive execution





What success looks like in this role?



‚Ä¢ Fewer things falling through the cracks

‚Ä¢ Clear priorities every day and week

‚Ä¢ Tasks and projects move forward without constant reminders

‚Ä¢ Life and business logistics feel ‚Äúhandled‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Less chaos, more clarity



If that sounds exciting to you, this role fits!



Core responsibilities



Daily / Ongoing



‚Ä¢ Managing tasks, reminders, and follow-ups

‚Ä¢ Keeping systems organized and up to date

‚Ä¢ Tracking priorities and deadlines

‚Ä¢ Proactively flagging issues or bottlenecks

‚Ä¢ Communicating clearly and concisely



Weekly



‚Ä¢ Light project management and coordination

‚Ä¢ Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

‚Ä¢ Improving existing systems and workflows

‚Ä¢ Preparing summaries and updates



Ongoing improvement



‚Ä¢ Creating structure where there is chaos

‚Ä¢ Documenting processes

‚Ä¢ Suggesting better tools or workflows

‚Ä¢ Learning fast and adapting to new responsibilities





What we care most about (non-negotiables)



‚Ä¢ Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



‚Ä¢ High loyalty and long-term mindset

We‚Äôre looking for someone who wants stability and growth together, not short-term gigs.



‚Ä¢ Extreme attention to detail

You notice small things others miss. You double-check. You follow instructions exactly.



‚Ä¢ Ownership mentality

You don‚Äôt wait to be told what broke. You flag it, fix it, and improve the system



‚Ä¢ Always hungry to learn

You enjoy getting better, learning tools, and expanding responsibility





Skills and experience (flexible but important)



‚Ä¢ Some project management experience

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with tasks, deadlines, and priorities

‚Ä¢ Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, or similar

‚Ä¢ Strong written English

‚Ä¢ Calm under pressure

‚Ä¢ Organized and structured by nature



Experience matters less than how you think



Who this role is NOT for (this saves time)



This role is not a fit if:

‚Ä¢ You want to juggle multiple jobs

‚Ä¢ You only want to execute tasks you‚Äôre told

‚Ä¢ You dislike structure, systems, or documentation

‚Ä¢ You need constant supervision

‚Ä¢ You prefer short-term work



Questions:



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role instead of multiple clients or freelance work?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience do you have (work or personal) that would make you a good fit for this role?



Question 5:

What tools or systems have you used to stay organized in past roles?





Important:

To apply, start your application message with the word ‚ÄúStructure‚Äù on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed



Breakdown Of the Initial Days:



First 30 days:



‚Ä¢ Execute tasks accurately

‚Ä¢ Learn systems and expectations

‚Ä¢ Build trust through consistency



After 60‚Äì90 days:



‚Ä¢ Proactively manage systems

‚Ä¢ Improve workflows

‚Ä¢ Take ownership of recurring areas

‚Ä¢ Act as a second brain, not just support

title: Operations Support Specialist
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a highly organised, detail-driven Operations Support Specialist to help keep our day-to-day operations running smoothly across logistics, inventory, and internal reporting.



This full-time role is critical to maintaining accuracy, accountability, and operational stability in a fast-moving e-commerce environment.



The Role

You will work closely with leadership and cross-functional teams to support fulfilment, inventory tracking, reporting, and operational coordination across multiple sales channels.



This is a hands-on execution role‚Äîideal for someone who loves structure, systems, and solving small problems before they become big ones.



Success in this role requires more than skills.

It requires a strong work ethic, honesty, integrity, and personal accountability.



We value tea
mbers who:

Take ownership of outcomes

Communicate truthfully and transparently

Care deeply about doing accurate, reliable work

Show consistency even when no one is watching



If you take genuine pride in being dependable, ethical, and detail-focused, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities

Operations & Logistics

Track inbound shipments (air & sea), FBA deliveries, and warehouse transfers

Monitor inventory levels across Amazon, Shopify, and 3PL

Flag stock risks, delays, or discrepancies early

Coordinate with freight forwarders, warehouses, and suppliers



Order & Fulfilment Support

Monitor order flow and fulfilment performance

Investigate delivery issues and returns

Work with Customer Support/Social Media and Partnerships Team to resolve operational cases

Ensure accurate tracking and status updates



Data, Reporting & Systems

Maintain trackers for inventory and shipments

Prepare simple daily/weekly summaries for leadership

Ensure data accuracy across spreadsheets, dashboards, and tools

Support process improvements and automation where possible



Cross-Team Coordination

Liaise with marketing, finance, customer support, and leadership

Keep tasks updated in project management tools

Follow through on action items and deadlines



Requirements

Must-Have

Strong organisation and attention to detail

Comfortable working in Google Sheets/Excel

Clear written communication in English

Ability to manage multiple priorities without losing accuracy

Problem-solver mindset with strong follow-through

Confidence working with limited instructions and finding solutions independently

Resourcefulness to quickly learn unfamiliar tools or systems



Character & Work Ethic (Very Important)

We care deeply about how work is done, not just the output.



We look for:

Honesty that is direct and unembellished.

Integrity that persists without observation.

Accountability that accepts error and corrects it.

Reliability that does not fluctuate.

Pride in quality work because accuracy matters here



These traits are non-negotiable for this role.



Working Style

Remote, fast-paced, and highly collaborative

High ownership with clear accountability

Strong focus on execution, accuracy, and consistency

A culture that values trust, transparency, and dependable performance



Our Hiring Process

We have created three practical challenges drawn from real operational situations.



These challenges are designed to evaluate your:

Attention to detail

Logical thinking

Writing clarity

Operational judgment

Integrity in how you approach problems



Only the first qualified applicant who completes the challenges successfully will be hired.



We hire carefully and move quickly.



If you meet the standard, apply now.

title: Fractional Chief of Staff (Integrator)
description:
Fractional Chief of Staff (Integrator)



Engagement: Fractional / Contract

 (10‚Äì25 hours per week, flexible)



About the Company

We are an early-stage, founder-led group of ventures led by a high-output visionary entrepreneur. One of our core businesses operates in the remodel and renovation industry, serving residential real estate projects, while other initiatives span unrelated but complementary ventures.

The founder is highly idea-driven and opportunity-focused. We are seeking a Fractional Chief of Staff who operates as an EOS-style Integrator‚Äîbringing structure, discipline, and follow-through to ensure ideas turn into executed, profitable outcomes.



The Role

The Fractional Chief of Staff is the founder‚Äôs execution partner and operational backbone. This role is designed for an experienced operator who can step in part-time and immediately bring clarity, prioritization, and project management rigor across multiple initiatives.

You will manage and track projects across ventures, with particular emphasis on supporting a remodel and renovation business where timelines, budgets, scope, and quality control matter. This role requires someone who can zoom out to align with big-picture strategy and zoom in to manage details, schedules, and deliverables.



Key Responsibilities

Vision-to-Execution Support

Partner closely with the founder to translate vision, ideas, and priorities into clear, actionable plans

Help define quarterly priorities, success metrics, and execution roadmaps

Ensure consistent follow-through and closure across all initiatives

Identify operational gaps and proactively solve them



Project Management (Core Focus)

Lead and oversee multiple projects across different ventures

Bring strong project management discipline: scope definition, timelines, milestones, ownership, and reporting

Manage dependencies and competing priorities across unrelated projects

Create visibility into project status, risks, and next actions



Remodel & Renovation Venture Support

Support project tracking for renovation and remodel jobs

Help implement systems for schedules, budgets, scope tracking, and documentation

Ensure consistent documentation, progress tracking, and follow-up across active projects

Improve clarity and accountability between field operations, vendors, and leadership



Communication & Alignment

Serve as a central point of coordination across stakeholders, contractors, and partners

Provide concise, high-signal updates to the founder

Translate operational realities into clear insights and recommendations

Detail Management & Follow-Through

Maintain a high bar for organization, accuracy, and completion

Ensure nothing falls through the cracks across fast-moving initiatives

Build systems that allow part-time leadership to have full visibility and control



Who You Are

An experienced Integrator / Chief of Staff / Operations Leader 

Highly skilled in project management, especially in complex environments

Detail-oriented, organized, and disciplined, with strong follow-through

Comfortable supporting a visionary founder with clarity, structure, and accountability (taking charge, directing, and being assertive when needed)

Able to context-switch across industries while maintaining focus and execution quality

Calm, practical, and decisive in ambiguous or fast-changing situations



Ideal Background & Experience

Strong project management background; construction, remodel, or renovation experience is a plus

Comfortable working with project management and documentation tools

Ability to operate independently with limited oversight

Experience supporting field-based or operationally complex businesses is a plus



If you are fit please reply I and let me know why you are the best candidate with a brief intro Loom video. 



Please also complete the following personality assessments: 


 (share the UNIQUE URL to your test results, make sure its sharable, hint test in a private browser). 

Visionary Integrator test here:

title: Hiring for Youtube channel Manager for Search Based channel
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented YouTube Channel Manager to manage and scale multiple search-driven YouTube channels. This role is focused on research, workflow coordination, and quality control ‚Äî not content creation.



Responsibilities

- Conduct daily topic and keyword research for search-based YouTube content

- Identify high-opportunity video topics using SEO and keyword tools

- Assign tasks to tea
mbers via Trello and manage workflow

- Track production timelines and ensure deadlines are met

- Review completed videos for quality, accuracy, and optimization

-Upload videos to YouTube with proper titles, descriptions, tags, and thumbnails

- Apply basic YouTube SEO best practices

- Maintain consistency and organization across channels



Requirements

- Experience with keyword research and SEO

- Familiarity with YouTube search-based content strategy

- Basic understanding of digital marketing principles

- Strong organizational and project management skills

- Experience using Trello or similar task management tools

- Attention to detail and quality control mindset

- Reliable communication and ability to manage remote teams



Nice to Have

- Experience managing YouTube channels

- Knowledge of YouTube analytics and optimization

- Familiarity with content scaling systems

- Understanding of audience retention and CTR optimization



Work Style

- Daily operational role

- Remote-friendly

-Requires consistent availability and communication

- Results-driven mindset

title: Looking for Twitter Account Manager (Part-Time | Remote)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable
 Account Manager to manage and grow a branded
 (X) account. This is a part-time remote role requiring 1‚Äì2 hours of daily commitment, ideal for someone experienced in social media management who enjoys writing engaging tweets, interacting with followers, and keeping a consistent online presence.



???? Responsibilities:



- Post 5 high-quality tweets per day (content ideas and data will be provided).

- Reply to 5‚Äì10 comments/replies per day to maintain engagement.

- Follow detailed Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and posting guidelines.

- Maintain consistent tone, voice, and timing across tweets.

- Monitor basic performance metrics (likes, retweets, replies) and flag notable patterns or feedback.

- Provide daily updates or summaries if required.



???? What You‚Äôll Get:



- All tweet data and content ideas provided.

- Clear SOPs, tweet templates, tone guides, and scheduling instructions.

- Flexible working hours (just be consistent with post timing).

- Supportive environment with clear communication and minimal guesswork.



???? Time Commitment:

~1 to 2 hours per day, 7 days a week.



???? Compensation:

$100 to $250/month, depending on your experience and quality of execution.



? Ideal Candidate Has:



- Proven experience managing or growing
 accounts.

- Excellent written English & able to use basic software/research tools.

- Basic Understanding of
 culture, trends, and engagement tactics.

- Strong sense of timing, consistency, and tone.

- Ability to follow clear instructions and processes.

- Familiarity with AI  tools like ChatGPT, Tweethunter, or Buffer is a plus.



???? How to Apply:

Please send us the following:



1. Links to
 accounts you‚Äôve managed (or screenshots showing your work).



2. A few sample tweets based on any topic you like.



3. A brief paragraph on why you‚Äôd be a good fit for this role.

title: Creator For How-To Tutorial Videos (Long-term, Native US/English accent required)
description:
Are you a video creator with a knack for making informative how-to/tutorial videos?



If so, we have an amazing opportunity for you to join our team and showcase your talents on our established YouTube channel.



We're looking for individuals who can create engaging step-by-step tutorials for software, apps, and
 marketing tools. Please note, these are not animated explainer videos; we require screen recordings.



Requirements:

- Proficiency in English (native speakers preferred)

- Willingness to record your phone/computer screen, along with your voice

- Ability to explain concepts clearly and concisely

- Access to a high-quality microphone



What's in it for you:

- Payment per video, paid on weekly basis. The more videos you create, the more you earn.

- Flexible work hours ‚Äì you can record at your convenience.

- Collaborate with a motivated team to produce valuable content.

- A long-term position offering stability and flexibility.



Payment info

- You'll be paid $2/minutes. Our ideal video length will be 10 to 15 minutes.

- You'll be able to make 1-2 videos everyday by working just 1-2 hours.

- Even if you make a 10 minute video every day, that'll be $20 per video. For 30 days, it will be 600 USD minimum.





If this opportunity appeals to you, we'd love to hear from you! Please include a voice sample with your message, and don't hesitate to ask any questions you may have. If you don‚Äôt include a voice sample I won‚Äôt react.

title: Real Estate Virtual Assistant - Inside Sales Agent
description:
Real Estate Virtual Assistant - Full-Time Inside Sales Agent

(Must have prior real estate experience)



Our St. Louis, MO, USA-based Real Estate Investments company, with over a decade in real estate investing, is seeking a dedicated and experienced real estate professional to join our growing team! If you enjoy negotiating deals, have a proven track record in real estate sales, and are looking for a remote opportunity where you can make an impact, please read the details and apply below by reading the how to apply instructions.



Job Description:

We are hiring for the position of Real Estate Inside Sales Agent. In this role, you will work remotely and be responsible for speaking with homeowners, gathering property information, negotiating offers, and securing contracts for our investment properties. Your main focus will be on acquiring distressed properties at favorable terms by getting property info, making offers, negotiating deals, and diligently following up to close sales. You will use your sales expertise and relationship-building skills to engage potential sellers, gather necessary information, and document interactions in our CRM system.



Responsibilities:

- Conduct outbound calls and send
s to manage real estate buying opportunities.

- Make offers to potential sellers and negotiate terms to get our offers accepted.

- Follow up on all leads and negotiations to ensure deal closure.

- Utilize effective sales strategies and scripts to handle objections and convey our company‚Äôs value proposition.

- Maintain detailed records of all interactions and negotiations in our CRM system.

- Collaborate with other tea
mbers to ensure seamless transaction processes.



Qualifications:

- High Energy and Enthusiastic Personality: You thrive in a fast-paced, engaging environment.

- 2+ Years of Real Estate Sales and Negotiations Experience: Proven background in closing deals.

- Exceptional English Communication Skills: Fluent in both written and verbal English.

- Fearless Negotiator: Eager to engage in challenging conversations, overcome objections, and secure agreements.

- Organized and Detail-Oriented: Excellent time management skills.

- Technologically Proficient: Experience using CRM systems and quick to learn new technologies.

- Problem Solver: Ability to navigate complex negotiations effectively.



System Requirements:

- Reliable high-speed laptop or desktop computer.

- DSL Internet connection with a minimum speed of 40+ Mbps.

- Noise-canceling headset.

- Must have a dedicated quiet home office setup



Performance Metrics:

- Talk to a certain number of sellers daily, weekly, and monthly.

- Achieve a target number of accepted offers each month.

- Consistently follow up to close deals within expected timeframes.



Career Growth & Training:

title: Collections Support Agent
description:
If you‚Äôve worked in BNPL/Credit and have solid customer service and payments collections experience, then this role is for you. Apply Here: 



Overview:

In this role, we‚Äôre searching for a Collections & Customer Operations Agent with amazing English skills and experience in finance, lending or BNPL (buy now, pay later).

As a Collections & Customer Operations Agent, you‚Äôll be a supportive partner for our customers ‚Äî helping them manage repayments, resolve arrears, and navigate their accounts with confidence. You‚Äôll deliver clear, empathetic support via chat,
, and phone, ensuring every interaction leads to timely and positive resolutions.



IMPORTANT: Please carefully read the responsibilities section below to ensure you're a good fit (we'll be testing you on most of these!), and follow the instructions on how to apply at the bottom.



Compensation:

* Competitive salary: $1,300 - $1,500 USD per month (depending on experience and your capabilities)



Benefits:

* 100% Remote - work from anywhere in the Philippines.

* 15 days paid leave

* Bi-weekly salary payouts

* Paid time off and regular Philippine public holidays

* Supportive, startup-style culture where your ideas matter



Working Hours:

* Training and Onboarding - Monday - Friday: 10 AM ‚Äì 5 PM UK time (6:00 PM ‚Äì 1:00 AM PH time)

* Normal shift schedule will be determined after training and onboarding

* Must be comfortable working during the weekends with weekdays rest days

* This is a full time role only (40 hours per week)



Job Responsibilities:

* Manage customer repayments and collections by supporting payment arrangements, rescheduling plans, and monitoring overdue accounts with care and accuracy.

* Deliver exceptional multi-channel support (chat,
, and phone), with a strong focus on resolving collections, repayment, and arrears-related inquiries on first contact.

* Communicate clearly, consistently, and professionally while upholding brand standards across all customer interactions.

* Handle and resolve collections-related concerns and complaints with empathy and efficiency, escalating complex or sensitive cases when appropriate.

* Support brand reputation by responding professionally to customer reviews and public feedback, particularly those related to billing and repayments.

* Protect the business by proactively identifying, investigating, and escalating suspicious activity and potential fraud related to payments or accounts.

* Use AI-driven tools and systems to streamline collections workflows, improve response times, and enhance the quality and consistency of support.

* Contribute to continuous improvement by sharing customer feedback and collections insights with internal teams to strengthen processes and customer outcomes.



You‚Äôre Perfect for This Role If You

* Have proven experience in customer service or collections, ideally within fintech, payments, or lending (BNPL experience is a plus).

* Are knowledgeable about repayments, arrears management, and basic fraud detection, with empathy for customers facing financial challenges.

* Communicate confidently and professionally across chat,
, and phone, adapting your approach to sensitive collections conversations.

* Are comfortable using CRM systems, AI tools, and automation to manage accounts and prioritize work efficiently.

* Thrive in a fast-paced, customer-first environment where priorities can shift quickly.

* Are a detail-oriented, empathetic problem solver who balances customer care with sound business judgment.

title: Mortgage Cold Calling & Loan Officer Assistant (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a long term, full time virtual assistant from the Philippines to help with cold calling, lead follow up, and simple admin work for a U.S. mortgage business. This is a stable role with clear tasks and training provided.



About the role

You will spend most of your time calling leads (new, old, and past clients) to find people interested in refinancing or getting a new home loan. You will ask basic questions, gather simple information, and set appointments for the lead mortgage loan originator. You will not sell or give loan advice; you will focus on calling, gathering info, and organizing the leads.



Main responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Make outbound calls to a list of leads each day (cold and warm leads).

‚Ä¢ Ask a short list of simple questions (reason for loan, timing, basic income range, property plans, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Identify who is interested and set appointments for the lead mortgage originator.

‚Ä¢ Take clear notes from each call and update the CRM with status (interested, follow?up, not interested, wrong number, etc.).

Spend a small part of each day learning basic information about mortgage loan programs so you can ask better questions over time.

What we are looking for

‚Ä¢ Strong spoken English and clear, friendly phone manner.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable making many outbound calls every day.

‚Ä¢ Good listening skills and accurate note?taking.

‚Ä¢ Reliable internet, a quiet place to work, and a good headset.

‚Ä¢ Organized, follows instructions, and open to feedback.

‚Ä¢ Willing to learn about the U.S. mortgage process over time.

mbers

Compliance, Testing & Quality Control

Continuously research industry changes, algorithm updates, and best practices



Required Skills & Experience

Essential Qualifications



Proven experience as a
 Ads Specialist or Paid Social Media Manager

Technical & Analytical Skills

Professional Attributes

title: Executive Assistant - Property Management
description:
Location: Remote (Work from Home - Must have home computer & internet)

Position Type: Independent Contractor with Benefits. 



Join Our Property Management Team!

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Leasing Agent & Assistant Property Manager. This is a dynamic, dual-focused role where your exceptional people skills and organizational abilities will be key to ensuring tenant satisfaction and the smooth operation of our properties. The ideal candidate will be the primary point of contact for our tenants, excelling in both customer service and the efficient coordination of all property maintenance requests.



FULL-TIME (40 working hours/week)

Work Availability Requirement: Monday-Friday 7AM ‚Äì 7PM U.S. Pacific Time

(will not be working the entire time frame, however availability requested. Work is still 40 hours / week)

‚ÄúOn Call‚Äù for Emergencies/Priorities during other times



Key Responsibilities

This role is centered around two core areas: Customer Service & Leasing and Maintenance Coordination.



Customer Service & Leasing

‚Ä¢ Tenant Relations: Serve as the primary, friendly point of contact for all current and prospective tenants, fostering a positive and professional landlord-tenant relationship.

‚Ä¢ Inquiry Management: Promptly and professionally respond to all tenant inquiries, questions, and concerns via phone,
, and in-person communication.

‚Ä¢ Leasing Activities: Conduct property showings for prospective tenants, answer questions about the units and community, and process rental applications.

‚Ä¢ Administrative Support: Assist with the preparation, execution, and renewal of lease agreements, ensuring all documentation is accurate and legally compliant.

‚Ä¢ Issue Resolution: Handle tenant complaints and conflicts with empathy and a problem-solving mindset, escalating complex issues to the Property Owner/Manager when necessary.



Maintenance Coordination

‚Ä¢ Request Intake: Receive, log, and prioritize all incoming maintenance and repair requests from tenants.

‚Ä¢ Vendor Management: Coordinate and schedule maintenance and repair work with approved vendors and contractors.

‚Ä¢ Follow-Up & Quality Control: Proactively follow up with tenants and vendors to ensure all maintenance requests are completed in a timely manner and to a high standard of quality.

‚Ä¢ Communication: Maintain clear and consistent communication with tenants regarding the status and estimated completion time of their maintenance requests.

‚Ä¢ Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and detailed records of all maintenance work orders, expenditures, and service history.



Preferred Qualifications and Skills

‚Ä¢ Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

‚Ä¢ A proactive, problem-solving attitude and the ability to work independently.

‚Ä¢ Quick thinking and verbal articulation in English (for example a skill used in cold calling and handling objections or concerns on the phone)

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with phone communication and soft selling on the phone

‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, particularly in managing multiple tasks and deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency with standard office software (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace).

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in a customer service or administrative (or property management-

related role).



What We Offer

‚Ä¢ Salary: Up to $500-$800 per month

‚Ä¢ Supportive Environment: A direct working relationship with the Property Owner/Manager and a focus on professional growth.

‚Ä¢ Long-term stability



About Us:

We‚Äôre a long-term rental company‚Äînot a short-term Airbnb operation‚Äîso we offer real stability and lasting roles. We value your skills, dedication, and ideas, and treat you as a true teammate, not just labor. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to build a long future and truly feel at home, you‚Äôll fit here. 



Testimonial written by Current PH Rep:

"Working with Heavenly Happy Homes over the past year has been an experience I am truly blessed and grateful for. It has indeed been life-changing. From the very beginning, I felt trusted, supported, and encouraged to do my best. That kind of environment makes a huge difference, especially when working remotely. After going through uncertainty in a previous role, I was really praying to find a company where I could grow, learn, and feel secure long-term. Heavenly Happy Homes turned out to be exactly that and more. You genuinely find yourself loving the company and sincerely caring about the work you do. The culture here is respectful and collaborative, and everyone truly wants to see each other succeed. Even as a remote team, there is a strong sense of teamwork and shared purpose, which I honestly love. Training is efficient and well guided. R.S. helped me a lot, especially in understanding processes clearly. Another thing I can sincerely say is that hard work here never goes unnoticed. It is always valued and genuinely appreciated. Our boss, is truly a wonderful employer!"



**How to Apply**

Submit your application here: 

Applications through OLJ may not be considered. Please complete the application at the link in this post.

title: Director of Marketing / Social Media Specialist
description:
Seeking a part-time Director of Marketing with a strategic mindset to spearhead our
 marketing and communications strategies, ultimately driving sales growth and enhancing customer retention. This position will be responsible for the comprehensive development and implementation of promotional efforts for the upcoming release of ‚ÄúSix Until Dawn.‚Äù 

The ideal candidate will blend innovative thinking with data-driven analysis to ensure messaging consistency, brand alignment, and measurable outcomes. This role also entails providing strategic oversight and operational support to facilitate the successful scaling of book sales. 



This opportunity is imbued with purpose and has the potential to make a significant impact by effectively communicating Jeannie Wishal‚Äôs work and values to a global audience.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

‚Ä¢
 Campaign Strategy: Design and execute a targeted marketing campaign for the author, focusing on both sales‚Äô generation and educational outreach. 

‚Ä¢ Content Creation: Craft a detailed overview of the author, Jeannie Wishal, that emphasizes her expertise and aligns with our strategic objectives. The focus should be on encouraging the target audience to engage in her literary works and highlighting how they complement and advance our mission and goals.

‚Ä¢ Campaign Management: Develop a dedicated webpage for promoting author book signings, incorporating functionality to direct potential readers to purchasing options for the book. This page should feature an engaging layout, integrate a calendar for upcoming events, and include hyperlinks to various retail platforms where the book is available for sale. Additionally, implement best practices to enhance visibility and drive people to the site.

‚Ä¢ Analytics and Reporting: Monitor response metrics and optimize sales conversions while pinpointing opportunities for enhancement.

‚Ä¢ Collaboration: Collaborate intensively with the author to devise comprehensive campaign strategies that align with overarching objectives and desired outcomes.

‚Ä¢ Customer Support: Deliver technical guidance and support to customers, troubleshooting issues effectively, and optimizing operational workflows for seamless performance.

‚Ä¢ Event Coordination: Coordinate the logistics for book signings, encompassing the planning and execution of setup, inventory control, and promotional initiatives to optimize engagement and operational efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Ensure meticulous documentation of all communications and interactions by leveraging suitable software solutions.



EDUCATION: Associate degree (minimum)



EXPERIENCE: Minimum of 3 years of experience related to Sales and Marketing.



CERTIFICATION: N/A



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

‚Ä¢ Exceptional time management and organization skills

‚Ä¢ Strong oral and written communication skills

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently, collaboratively, and under supervision.

‚Ä¢ Willingness to serve and build relationships with customers and the author

‚Ä¢ Must possess strong initiative, leadership skills, organizational and project management skills, with the ability to multitask in managing a variety of projects and priorities, coordinating the actions of others, follow through on duties to timely completion, and demonstrate excellent judgment with attention to detail.

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Office experience with Word, Outlook, Publisher, Excel, and PowerPoint software experience.

‚Ä¢ Must support the author‚Äôs mission.



WORKING CONDITIONS: Work is performed indoors, with minimal safety hazards, and requires seated, standing, and moving work.



The outlined responsibilities and qualifications should not be viewed as an exhaustive list of all expectations for this role; instead, they delineate the core criteria for this position. Currently, this is a part-time role, with the potential to convert to full-time contingent upon exceeding sales and marketing performance benchmarks.



Applicants should submit a link to their CV as part of the application. In your cover letter, state the years of experience in marketing and share a brief summary of your marketing experience and the roles you have previously worked in.

title: Collections Agent at a Fintech Startup
description:
If you‚Äôve worked in BNPL/Credit and have solid customer service and payments collections experience, then this role is for you. Apply Here: 
/appqyBZJyyxs1htVk/pagvvCsolTY5tzwa7/form



Overview:

In this role, we‚Äôre searching for a Collections & Customer Operations Agent with amazing English skills and experience in finance, lending or BNPL (buy now, pay later).

As a Collections & Customer Operations Agent, you‚Äôll be a supportive partner for our customers ‚Äî helping them manage repayments, resolve arrears, and navigate their accounts with confidence. You‚Äôll deliver clear, empathetic support via chat,
, and phone, ensuring every interaction leads to timely and positive resolutions.



IMPORTANT: Please carefully read the responsibilities section below to ensure you're a good fit (we'll be testing you on most of these!), and follow the instructions on how to apply at the bottom.



Compensation:

* Competitive salary: $1,300 - $1,500 USD per month (depending on experience and your capabilities)



Benefits:

* 100% Remote - work from anywhere in the Philippines.

* 15 days paid leave

* Bi-weekly salary payouts

* Paid time off and regular Philippine public holidays

* Supportive, startup-style culture where your ideas matter



Working Hours:

* Training and Onboarding - Monday - Friday: 10 AM ‚Äì 5 PM UK time (6:00 PM ‚Äì 1:00 AM PH time)

* Normal shift schedule will be determined after training and onboarding

* Must be comfortable working during the weekends with weekdays rest days

* This is a full time role only (40 hours per week)



Job Responsibilities:

* Manage customer repayments and collections by supporting payment arrangements, rescheduling plans, and monitoring overdue accounts with care and accuracy.

* Deliver exceptional multi-channel support (chat,
, and phone), with a strong focus on resolving collections, repayment, and arrears-related inquiries on first contact.

* Communicate clearly, consistently, and professionally while upholding brand standards across all customer interactions.

* Handle and resolve collections-related concerns and complaints with empathy and efficiency, escalating complex or sensitive cases when appropriate.

* Support brand reputation by responding professionally to customer reviews and public feedback, particularly those related to billing and repayments.

* Protect the business by proactively identifying, investigating, and escalating suspicious activity and potential fraud related to payments or accounts.

* Use AI-driven tools and systems to streamline collections workflows, improve response times, and enhance the quality and consistency of support.

* Contribute to continuous improvement by sharing customer feedback and collections insights with internal teams to strengthen processes and customer outcomes.



You‚Äôre Perfect for This Role If You

* Have proven experience in customer service or collections, ideally within fintech, payments, or lending (BNPL experience is a plus).

* Are knowledgeable about repayments, arrears management, and basic fraud detection, with empathy for customers facing financial challenges.

* Communicate confidently and professionally across chat,
, and phone, adapting your approach to sensitive collections conversations.

* Are comfortable using CRM systems, AI tools, and automation to manage accounts and prioritize work efficiently.

* Thrive in a fast-paced, customer-first environment where priorities can shift quickly.

* Are a detail-oriented, empathetic problem solver who balances customer care with sound business judgment.



How to Apply:

* Click the link below to submit your application and let's get started: 
/appqyBZJyyxs1htVk/pagvvCsolTY5tzwa7/form

title: GoHighLevel Specialist
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced GoHighLevel Specialist to join our team. As a GoHighLevel Specialist, you will play a crucial role in leveraging the GoHighLevel platform to create, implement, and optimize marketing campaigns and automation workflows for our clients. Your expertise will be key in achieving our client's digital marketing goals and ensuring they get the most out of the platform capabilities.
